original: gnyis ka la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi theg pa chen po'i phyogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis ka la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi theg pa chen po'i phyogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the aspect of the Mahayana, which has the characteristic of the selflessness of both,

original: chos bdag med pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste zhes @159b pa la //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste zhes @159b pa la //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe selflessness of phenomena is natural luminosity.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa dang rnam rig tsam ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa dang rnam rig tsam ste /
translated: All phenomena are the aggregates and so forth, and mere awareness.

original: de dag rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa ste stong pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin gyis bdag med pa ste stong pa'o //
translated: They are naturally selfless, that is, empty.

original: sgom pa ni 'di la rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum yan lag yin ta //
analyzed: sgom pa ni 'di la rnam par thar ba'i sgo gsum yan lag yin ta //
translated: Meditation has three doors of liberation as its branches.

original: de la chos thams cad stong pa yin te //
analyzed: de la chos thams cad stong pa yin te //
translated: Among them, all phenomena are empty.

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir te gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir te gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: Because they are free from one and many, like a reflection.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not created by a cause such as a divine creator,

original: rgyu rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because causes do not exist.

original: smon pa'i 'bras bu yang ma yin te //
analyzed: smon pa'i 'bras bu yang ma yin te //
translated: They are not the result of a wish,

original: smon lam la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam la sogs pa dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because aspirations and so forth are not observed.

original: de ltar 'od gsal ba zhes nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'od gsal ba zhes nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus it is summarized as ‚Äúnatural luminosity.‚Äù

original: gang gi rang bzhin ngo bo yod ma yin //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin ngo bo yod ma yin //
translated: The nature of that which does not exist

original: ngo bo med de gzhan gyi ji ltar rgyu //
analyzed: ngo bo med de gzhan gyi ji ltar rgyu //
translated: How can a nonexistent entity be a cause?

original: ngo bo med pas ji ltar 'bras bu skye //
analyzed: ngo bo med pas ji ltar 'bras bu skye //
translated: How can an effect arise from a nonexistent entity?

original: bde bar gshegs pas gtan tshigs ji ltar gsungs //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas gtan tshigs ji ltar gsungs //
translated: How can the Sugata be said to have taught a reason?

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: yi ge aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te //
analyzed: yi ge aa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te //
translated: the letter A is the door of all dharmas,

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of non-arising from the beginning.

original: yi ge tsa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
analyzed: yi ge tsa ni chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
translated: The letter Ca is the door of all dharmas,

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of non-transmigration and non-birth.

original: yi ge sha chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
analyzed: yi ge sha chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
translated: The letter Sha is the door of all dharmas,

original: zhi ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of peace.

original: yi ge ha chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
analyzed: yi ge ha chos thams cad kyi sgo yin te /
translated: The letter Ha is the door of all dharmas,

original: dga' ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of joy and nirvana.

original: de la sogs pa chos kyi yi ge nges pa'i tshig gi sgo nas bdag med pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la sogs pa chos kyi yi ge nges pa'i tshig gi sgo nas bdag med pa nyid bstan to //
translated: In this way, selflessness is taught through the door of the etymological definitions of the letters of the Dharma.

original: de ltar chos bdag med pa nyid ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos bdag med pa nyid ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Thus, the selflessness of phenomena is clear light,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from grasped and grasper.

original: chags bral dang chags pa dang chags pa bar ma'i rim gyis rnam par sbyangs pa'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chags bral dang chags pa dang chags pa bar ma'i rim gyis rnam par sbyangs pa'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth reality is the purification by means of the stages of the absence of passion, passion, and the middle, which is neither.üîΩThe equality of that is nonduality.

original: de dang mnyam pa nyid ni gnyis su med pa yin par dgongs so zhes pa ni ji ltar bdag nyid kyis 'od gsal ba nyams su myong ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyis khams gsum pa yang 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa nyid ni gnyis su med pa yin par dgongs so zhes pa ni ji ltar bdag nyid kyis 'od gsal ba nyams su myong ba de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de nyid kyis khams gsum pa yang 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o
translated: Just as one experiences the clear light by oneself, so one should see the three realms as having the nature of clear light by means of that samƒÅdhi.

original: // dper na ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bdag nyid 'od gsal bar byas nas khams gsum pa yang de bzhin du bya ba ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: // dper na ril por 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bdag nyid 'od gsal bar byas nas khams gsum pa yang de bzhin du bya ba ni rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: For example, having made oneself clear light by means of the samƒÅdhi of apprehending the whole, one should do the same to the three realms. That is the samƒÅdhi of subsequent destruction.

original: rab tu byed pa las /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las /
translated: The topic divisions states:

original: mgo bo nas ni rkang pa'i bar //
analyzed: mgo bo nas ni rkang pa'i bar //
translated: From the head to the feet,

original: ji srid snying gar phyin gyi bar //
analyzed: ji srid snying gar phyin gyi bar //
translated: up to the heart,üîΩthe yoga enters the perfect endpoint,

original: rnal 'byor yang dag mtha' la 'jug / ril por 'dzin pa de bshad do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor yang dag mtha' la 'jug / ril por 'dzin pa de bshad do //
translated: that is explained as apprehending the whole.

original: brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba dag / sngon du 'od gsal bar @160a * //
analyzed: brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba dag / sngon du 'od gsal bar @160a * //
translated: having been made clear light

original: byas te // phyi nas de bzhin bdag byas pa'i //
analyzed: byas te // phyi nas de bzhin bdag byas pa'i //
translated: then, in the same way, one‚Äôs own

original: rjes su 'jig pa'i rim 'di yin //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rjes su 'jig pa'i rim 'di yin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: this is the sequence of dissolution.

original: chos bdag med pa ste de rnams dang mnyam pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa ste de rnams dang mnyam pa nyid yin pas /
translated: The absence of self in phenomena is the equality of those.

original: shes pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i dngos po'i tshogs ngo bo med pa 'od gsal ba dang mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: shes pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i dngos po'i tshogs ngo bo med pa 'od gsal ba dang mtshungs pas so //
translated: Knowledge is the same as clear light, the absence of entity of the collection of things that abide in one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continuums.

original: rang gi sems zhes pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i sems so //
analyzed: rang gi sems zhes pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa'i sems so //
translated: One‚Äôs own mind is the mind that abides in one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continuums.

original: ye nas ma skyes pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ye nas ma skyes pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Primordially non-arisen is the nature of clear light.üîΩThe body of the indivisible three vajras is that which has the nature of the body of Great Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i lus ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa'i lus ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is so called.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo ste //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo ste //
translated: The essence of emptiness

original: zhes pa ni lhag cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ming gi rnam grangs can chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lhag cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ming gi rnam grangs can chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the term clear light, which is a synonym for the great bliss that is coemergent, and which is the essence of the pristine wisdom of the ultimate realm.

original: mig gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la nye par mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la nye par mtshon pa yin te /
translated: It is not an object of the eye, and so on, because it is not an object of the sense organs.

original: dbang po kun las 'das pa yang yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po kun las 'das pa yang yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: It is also to be understood as transcending all the sense organs,

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is uncompounded.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa ni rim pa bzhi pas mngon par byang chub pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa ni rim pa bzhi pas mngon par byang chub pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-intentional is the fourth stage, because it teaches the manifest enlightenment.

original: mi bskyod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the verse of Akshobhya,

original: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni mi zad cing 'jig par mi 'gyur bas na mi zad pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni mi zad cing 'jig par mi 'gyur bas na mi zad pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: the imperishable is the ultimate truth, because it is imperishable and indestructible.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrtan zhing snying po khong stong med //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro // brtan zhing snying po khong stong med //
translated: It is not born and does not perish.üîΩIt is firm, substantial, and without hollowness.

original: gcod med dbyer med mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: gcod med dbyer med mtshan nyid med //
translated: It is indivisible, without characteristics,

original: sred pa med cing 'jig med pa //
analyzed: sred pa med cing 'jig med pa //
translated: without craving, and without destruction.

original: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer bshad //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni rdo rjer bshad //
translated: Emptiness is explained as the vajra.

original: ces rdo rje rtse mo las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces rdo rje rtse mo las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the Vajra≈õekhara Tantra.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid de sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid de sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The ‚Äúlimit of reality‚Äù is suchness, the reality of clear light that is to be attained by the process of purifying the mind.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste zhes pa ni bdud thams cad kyis dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste zhes pa ni bdud thams cad kyis dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the vajra, because it cannot be split by any demons.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The samƒÅdhi that focuses on that is the one-pointed mind that has the character of the stages of mantra and mudrƒÅ.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: It is the meaning of ‚Äúhaving entered into union with that.‚Äù

original: / phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po 'di rnams zhes pa ni /
analyzed: / phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po 'di rnams zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThese things that have the nature of the outer and inner‚Äù

original: snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcud kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin gyis snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcud kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin gyis snang ba'i rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
translated: are the three consciousnesses that appear with the nature of the world of the environment and the world of the inhabitants.üîΩ‚ÄúThey are unborn‚Äù

original: de dag ma skyes pa ste zhes pa ni //
analyzed: de dag ma skyes pa ste zhes pa ni //
translated: means

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas spong bar 'gyur na rang bzhin med pa de @160b nyid do //üîΩrang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thams cad stong pa'am /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas spong bar 'gyur na rang bzhin med pa de @160b nyid do // rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thams cad stong pa'am /
translated: If it is abandoned by the stages of mantra and mudra, it is just the absence of intrinsic nature.üîΩBecause of natural luminosity.

original: gnas la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: gnas la 'jug pas so //
translated: This is the emptiness of everything, or the engagement in the basis.üîΩTherefore, phenomena are non-existent.

original: de bas na chos rnams re zhig med pa kho na'o zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas rnam par shes pa gsum spong bar 'gyur na yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyud de las so //
analyzed: de bas na chos rnams re zhig med pa kho na'o zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas rnam par shes pa gsum spong bar 'gyur na yod pa ma yin pa'i rgyud de las so //
translated: This is because the three consciousnesses are abandoned by the reasoning explained above.üîΩFrom that non-existent continuum,

original: chos nyid med pa ste zhes pa ni de rnams kyi chos nyid kyang med //
analyzed: chos nyid med pa ste zhes pa ni de rnams kyi chos nyid kyang med //
translated: the reality is non-existent.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum med pas de las byung ba'i shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa'i ngo bo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum med pas de las byung ba'i shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa'i ngo bo //
translated: This is because the three consciousnesses do not exist. The wisdom, method, and ignorance that arise from thatüîΩdo not exist.

original: nyin dang mtshan mo rang bzhin brgya drug cu yang med do //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo rang bzhin brgya drug cu yang med do //
translated: The one hundred and sixty natures of day and night also do not exist.üîΩBecause phenomena do not exist.

original: chos rnams med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni sems kyi rang bzhin rnam par shes pa gsum med pas so //
analyzed: chos rnams med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni sems kyi rang bzhin rnam par shes pa gsum med pas so //
translated: This is because the nature of mind, the three consciousnesses, do not exist.

original: rang bzhin gyi tshogs ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rtsa ba can yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi tshogs ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rtsa ba can yin te /
translated: The natural collection is rooted in the three consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum med na de las byung ba'i sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams kyang med de rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum med na de las byung ba'i sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams kyang med de rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the three consciousnesses do not exist, then the mental factors that arise from them also do not exist, because they have no cause.

original: de bas na 'di ltar nam mkha' lta bur bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni de nyid thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar nam mkha' lta bur bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni de nyid thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúlike space, it has the characteristic of selflessness‚Äù is the particularity of the reality of clear light called ‚Äúall of that is empty.‚Äù

original: byang chub pa'i thabs so zhes pa ni sems kyi 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyi lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub pa'i thabs so zhes pa ni sems kyi 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid kyi lam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe method of enlightenment‚Äù is the path of reality that has the characteristic of entering the clear light of the mind.

original: snying po yod pa yin no zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas brtan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying po yod pa yin no zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas brtan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt has a core‚Äù means that it becomes stable by means of the mantra and mudra stages.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pas gsungs pa ste zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam pa dag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pas gsungs pa ste zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam pa dag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The TathƒÅgata Ak·π£obhya said means that it is the essence of the purification of the aggregate of consciousness.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The non-intentional means that it is taught for the sake of the stage of the purification of mind.

original: / bdag med pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas 'od gsal ba nyid don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: / bdag med pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa gsum rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas 'od gsal ba nyid don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The selflessness is the ultimate truth means that since it is the characteristic of the purification of the three consciousnesses that are the nature of all tathƒÅgatas, the clear light itself is explained as the ultimate truth.

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo thams cad stong pa'i go 'phang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo thams cad stong pa'i go 'phang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The essence of the purification of appearance and so on is the stage of emptiness of everything, which is to say, the stage of the clear light.

original: de nyid rdo rje zhes pa ni sa bcu pa la ye shes kyi dbang thob pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams so zhes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos dang ldan pa rnam par
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje zhes pa ni sa bcu pa la ye shes kyi dbang thob pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams so zhes pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos dang ldan pa rnam par
translated: That itself is the vajra.üîΩThe ten stages are the attainment of the knowledge empowerment and the defiled and undefiled.

original: shes pa gsum mo //üîΩmtshan @161a * //
analyzed: shes pa gsum mo // mtshan @161a * //
translated: The three consciousnesses are the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral dharmas.üîΩBecause of the absence of signs,

original: ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rgyu med pas so //
analyzed: ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rgyu med pas so //
translated: the three consciousnesses are without cause.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam spangs pa //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam spangs pa //
translated: The characteristic of dharma is abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos ni rnam par shes pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos ni rnam par shes pa gsum ste /
translated: Dharma is the three consciousnesses.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gang gi mtshon par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gang gi mtshon par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of those is the characteristic that is to be illustrated.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: The nature of the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral [dharmas] is abandoned.

original: rnam par spang bya ba ni de med pa'i 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par spang bya ba ni de med pa'i 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The abandonment is the clear light that is the absence of those.

original: 'di nyid du ni rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di nyid du ni rigs pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the reasoning of that,

original: re zhig chos rnams nyid ma grub na zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum nyid sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas spong bar 'gyur na nang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: re zhig chos rnams nyid ma grub na zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum nyid sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas spong bar 'gyur na nang med pa kho na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the dharmas themselves are not established,‚Äù means that if the three consciousnesses are abandoned by the process of mantra and seal, then they are absolutely nonexistent.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ga la yod de zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi sems las 'byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams ga las yod /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ga la yod de zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi sems las 'byung ba'i rang bzhin rnams ga las yod /
translated: ‚ÄúHow can they have characteristics?‚Äù means that from where can the mental factors of those consciousnesses exist?

original: mo gsham gyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan to //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe son of a barren woman,‚Äù etc. teaches the example.

original: 'o na ji ltar lha'i sku bskyed ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gi tshe 'od gsal ba mngon du gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar lha'i sku bskyed ce na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gi tshe 'od gsal ba mngon du gyur na /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, how is the divine body generated?‚Äù etc. When the clear light manifests,

original: de'i tshe sems can gyi don ma yin no zhes de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir lha'i sku bskyed pa bstan te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sems can gyi don ma yin no zhes de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir lha'i sku bskyed pa bstan te /
translated: at that time it is not for the benefit of sentient beings. In order to establish that, the generation of the divine body is taught.

original: 'od gsal ba las cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku spro ba ni lha'i sku bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las cig car ram snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku spro ba ni lha'i sku bskyed pa'o //
translated: The generation of the divine body is the projection of the gnosis body from the clear light, either instantaneously or by the process of attaining the radiant light, etc.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes pa ni thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes pa ni thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: Ultimate truth is the emptiness of everything.

original: de las rang la byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa ni rim pa gsum pas so //
analyzed: de las rang la byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa ni rim pa gsum pas so //
translated: From that, the stage called ‚Äúself-consecration‚Äù is the third stage.

original: kun 'byung bas na zhes pa la cig car ram rim gyis sgyu ma lta bu de nyid du skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun 'byung bas na zhes pa la cig car ram rim gyis sgyu ma lta bu de nyid du skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is the origin of everything, it is the ‚Äúsource of everything.‚Äù The meaning is that it is born as the illusion-like [mind of clear light] either instantaneously or gradually.

original: 'o na 'od gsal ba ni bag chags kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa yin na de las lha'i sku ji ltar bskyed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'od gsal ba ni bag chags kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa yin na de las lha'i sku ji ltar bskyed ce na /
translated: Well then, since the clear light is non-conceptual because it is free from all the stains of habitual tendencies, how is the body of a deity generated from that?

original: smras pa / sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyis 'byung ba'i zhes pa ni sngar bsags pa'i thugs rje chen po dang smon lam gyi shugs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smras pa / sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyis 'byung ba'i zhes pa ni sngar bsags pa'i thugs rje chen po dang smon lam gyi shugs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúarising by the force of previous impulsion,‚Äù meaning by the force of the previously accumulated great compassion and aspirational prayers.

original: skyon rnams thams cad skyed byed 'jig tshogs lta bu'i bud shing rnam sreg pa //
analyzed: skyon rnams thams cad skyed byed 'jig tshogs lta bu'i bud shing rnam sreg pa //
translated: It burns the fuel of the view of the transitory collection, which produces all faults.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi bye brag yul rnam gnyis spangs de yi skyon 'byung med //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi bye brag yul rnam gnyis spangs de yi skyon 'byung med //
translated: It is free from the two types of objects, the distinction of self and other, and the faults of that do not arise.

original: nyes pa med kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu las la thugs rjes rig bzhin bskul //
analyzed: nyes pa med kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu las la thugs rjes rig bzhin bskul //
translated: Although there is no fault, the illusory person is urged by compassion to act, knowing.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyis ni blo bzang 'jug ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyis ni blo bzang 'jug ste /
translated: The good mind enters by former vow,

original: rdza mkhan 'khor lo shugs bzhir @161b 'phen //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rdza mkhan 'khor lo shugs bzhir @161b 'phen // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: like the potter's wheel.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pas kyang sems can gyi don mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'od gsal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pas kyang sems can gyi don mdzad de /
translated: Thus, the Blessed Buddha, even while dwelling in the illumination samƒÅdhi, acts for the sake of sentient beings.

original: skyes bu yid bzhin nor bu bzhin //
analyzed: skyes bu yid bzhin nor bu bzhin //
translated: Like the wish-fulfilling gem,

original: de yi gnas pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: de yi gnas pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: by his mere presence,

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa rnams las kyang //üîΩji bzhin bstan pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa rnams las kyang // ji bzhin bstan pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: from walls, etc.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the teachings issue forth as appropriate.

original: dgongs pa ma yin zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag byin gyis brlab pa gnyis 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag byin gyis brlab pa gnyis 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-intentional refers to the explanation of the two, the pure mind and the self-consecration.

original: ye shes kyi 'od zer zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dri'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'od zer zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dri'o //
translated: He asks with rays of the light of intuition, etc.,

original: 'od gsal ba'i snang ba zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i snang ba zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: and answers with the illumination of the light of intuition.

original: 'od gsal ba ni de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o//
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni de kho na nyid bzhi pa'o//
translated: The luminous is the fourth reality.

original: snang ba ni gsal ba ste bde ba chen pos so sor snang ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni gsal ba ste bde ba chen pos so sor snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance is the manifestation, the manifestation of great bliss.

original: de nyid rdo rje ste zhes pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje ste zhes pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the vajra, because it is the essence of the vajra-like samadhi.

original: 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa rnams la'o zhes pa ni chags pa dang bral ba dang chags pa dang chags pa bar ma spong bar 'gyur ba dang // ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su 'jig pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag kyang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa rnams la'o zhes pa ni chags pa dang bral ba dang chags pa dang chags pa bar ma spong bar 'gyur ba dang // ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su 'jig pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag kyang spang bar bya'o //
translated: With regard to the compounded and the uncompounded, one should abandon attachment, non-attachment, and middling attachment, and also abandon the samadhis of grasping the whole and subsequent disintegration.

original: bsgom par bya ba med pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid thob na de rnams bsgom par bya bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba med pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid thob na de rnams bsgom par bya bar mi rigs te /
translated: There is nothing to be cultivated, because when one attains the reality of luminous clarity, it is not reasonable to cultivate those.

original: 'bras bu thob pas thabs dor bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pas thabs dor bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the method should be abandoned upon attaining the result.

original: 'bras bu thob pas gang 'dor ba de ni thabs zhes bshad pa yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pas gang 'dor ba de ni thabs zhes bshad pa yin /
translated: That which is abandoned upon attaining the result is explained as the method.

original: de ltar kha cig me sgron mas //
analyzed: de ltar kha cig me sgron mas //
translated: Thus, some with the lamp of fire

original: lam la mthong ste de nyid bor //
analyzed: lam la mthong ste de nyid bor //
translated: Seeing it on the path, one abandons it.

original: shes pas shes bya gzigs nas ni //
analyzed: shes pas shes bya gzigs nas ni //
translated: Having seen the knowable with knowledge,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dor bar bya //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //üîΩyang na bsgom par bya ba med pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i yul du nyin mo dang mtshan mo mtshams dang chags dang chags bral dang chags pa bar ma rnams ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dor bar bya // zhes 'byung ngo // yang na bsgom par bya ba med pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i yul du nyin mo dang mtshan mo mtshams dang chags dang chags bral dang chags pa bar ma rnams ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: the Tathagata abandons it.

original: 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa dag dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa dag dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, there is nothing to meditate on means that in the domain of clear light, day, night, the juncture, attachment, detachment, and the middle of attachment are not to be meditated on because they are the delight of the compounded and uncompounded.

original: mtshan mo snang ba'i cha ste nyi ma'i 'od zer 'gyed pa snang ba mched pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan mo snang ba'i cha ste nyi ma'i 'od zer 'gyed pa snang ba mched pa yin //
translated: Night is the aspect of illumination, the radiance of the sun's rays is the increase of illumination.

original: mtshams ni snang ba mched pa rang gi rang bzhin lhan cig min dang sbyar //
analyzed: mtshams ni snang ba mched pa rang gi rang bzhin lhan cig min dang sbyar //
translated: The juncture is the nature of the increase of illumination, not simultaneous with itself.

original: mtshan mo ma yin mtshams min nyin min rang bzhin gang dag pa //
analyzed: mtshan mo ma yin mtshams min nyin min rang bzhin gang dag pa //
translated: That which is neither night, nor the juncture, nor day, is pure nature.

original: de ni byang chub skad cig bla ma mchog bshad rnal 'byor ba nyid yul //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni byang chub skad cig bla ma mchog bshad rnal 'byor ba nyid yul //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
translated: That is the object of the supreme yoga, the moment of enlightenment.

original: bsgom pa yang med de zhes bya ba ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par yang med do //
analyzed: bsgom pa yang med de zhes bya ba ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par yang med do //
translated: There is also no meditation means that there is no special meditative stabilization of one-pointedness of mind for the purpose of attaining that.

original: @162a * // bsgom par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la bsgom par bya ba ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: @162a * // bsgom par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la bsgom par bya ba ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Because there is nothing to meditate upon, where to meditate upon is clear light,

original: de med pa ni 'dus byas pa'i tshul du med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa dang / bsgom pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma sel ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa ni 'dus byas pa'i tshul du med pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa dang / bsgom pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma sel ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist in the manner of being compounded, because it exists by way of its own entity, and because meditation has the characteristic of removing adventitious defilements.

original: 'o na lha'i rnal 'byor du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na lha'i rnal 'byor du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes pa ni /
translated: Well then, how is it divine yoga?

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intention.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa thob pas zag pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i chad pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa thob pas zag pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa don dam pa'i bden pa la 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i chad pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of attaining the stage of manifest enlightenment, it would follow that the yogi/nƒ´ who enters into the uncontaminated, non-conceptual ultimate truth would have the characteristic of the extreme of annihilation.

original: de bas de spang bar bya ba'i phyir lha'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de bas de spang bar bya ba'i phyir lha'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon that, it is proper to cultivate the yoga of the deity.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas rtogs par bya ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas rtogs par bya ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pa ste /
translated: The ultimate truth is the fourth reality to be realized by means of the stages of the seal and meditative concentration.

original: de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is like space.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni de las byung ba'i rdo rje'i sku spros pas te sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni de las byung ba'i rdo rje'i sku spros pas te sems can gyi don gyi bya ba la gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conventional truth is the emanation of the vajra body that arises from that, because it is the basis for the performance of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: gcig tu gyur pa ste zhes pa la bzhi pa dang lnga pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i don dam pa dang lha'i sku dag yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa ste zhes pa la bzhi pa dang lnga pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i don dam pa dang lha'i sku dag yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The single state is the union of the ultimate and the deity body to be attained by means of the fourth and fifth stages.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun tu 'od kyi sa la gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bdag dang gzhan la phan thogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun tu 'od kyi sa la gnas pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bdag dang gzhan la phan thogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase by those and so forth teaches that the yogi should meditate on the body of Great Vajradhara abiding on the stage of Universal Radiance as the cause of benefit for self and other.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa ni mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa dag 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa ni mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa dag 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase not the intended meaning is because [the Buddha] wishes to explain the stages of manifest enlightenment and union.

original: bshad zin to zhes pa ni le'u dang po nas bshad pa rnam pa bzhi pos bstan to //
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes pa ni le'u dang po nas bshad pa rnam pa bzhi pos bstan to //
translated: The phrase already explained is taught by the four explanations in the first chapter.

original: chos rnams rang bzhin 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin 'od gsal ba //
translated: The nature of phenomena is clear light.

original: zhes pa 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid bstan te /
translated: This teaches the samƒÅdhi of union.

original: rang bzhin ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: Nature is the conventional truth,

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi khyad par gyis byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi khyad par gyis byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is made by the distinctions of causes and conditions.

original: 'od gsal ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes pa la /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes pa la /
translated: Clear light is the ultimate truth.

original: rtag pa dri ma med pa zag pa med cing de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dri ma med pa zag pa med cing de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent, stainless, uncontaminated, and the nature of reality.

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: External and internal things are called ‚Äúthe things that are moving and unmoving.‚Äù

original: bden pa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rim pa gsum pa dang lnga pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku dang / rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rim pa gsum pa dang lnga pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku dang / rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the two truths is the nature of the vajra body, which is the nature of the clear light to be attained by the second and fourth stages, and the nature of the body of wisdom to be attained by the third and fifth stages.

original: de bas zhes bya ba la @162b sogs pas chos nyid kyi phyogs la brten te rang bzhin gyis dag pa nam mkha' dang chos mthun pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la @162b sogs pas chos nyid kyi phyogs la brten te rang bzhin gyis dag pa nam mkha' dang chos mthun pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, etc. shows the similarity of the naturally pure reality to space, based on the side of reality.

original: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid do zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid do zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the result is the nature of the vajra body, which is the nature of the stage of union, because it is beyond training.

original: de thob pa'i rgyu ste zhes pa ni //
analyzed: de thob pa'i rgyu ste zhes pa ni //
translated: The cause of attaining that is the nature of the cause.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four stages are vajra repetition and so on.

original: de rnams kyis rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngag dang sems dang lus dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa rnam par dag pa thob par byed pa sgom pas zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngag dang sems dang lus dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa rnam par dag pa thob par byed pa sgom pas zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By those, one obtains the purity of speech, mind, body, conventional and ultimate, respectively, because one obtains the concentration of union through meditation.

original: zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas //
analyzed: zung 'jug gi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas //
translated: One who abides in the concentration of union

original: slar zhing gang la'ang mi slob po //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slar zhing gang la'ang mi slob po // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: does not train in anything again.üîΩBecause cause and effect are inseparable.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can gyi zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin de kho na nyid ces bya ba thob nas 'di'i rgyu dang 'di'i 'bras bu zhes tha dad par mi snang
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can gyi zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin de kho na nyid ces bya ba thob nas 'di'i rgyu dang 'di'i 'bras bu zhes tha dad par mi snang
translated: Having obtained the concentration of union, which is characterized by the exalted wisdom of omniscience, called the reality of thatness, cause and effect do not appear as different,

original: ste de ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ste de ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is their nature.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa dag go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa dag go //
translated: The cause and effect are the four stages of vajra repetition, etc. , and the stage of union.

original: mi phyed par yongs su shes pa nyid ni zhes pa la /
analyzed: mi phyed par yongs su shes pa nyid ni zhes pa la /
translated: The knowledge of indivisibility is

original: slob pa'i gnas skabs su yang lam ni de kho na nyid du mos pa'i phyir 'bras bu thob nas kyang lam ni de dang ro gcig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa'i gnas skabs su yang lam ni de kho na nyid du mos pa'i phyir 'bras bu thob nas kyang lam ni de dang ro gcig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path is imagined to be reality even in the state of learning, and because the path becomes of one taste with that after attaining the result.

original: las dang po pa can 'jug par bya ba'i don du rim pa'i dbye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye ba rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: las dang po pa can 'jug par bya ba'i don du rim pa'i dbye bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye ba rab tu bstan to //
translated: The division of cause and effect is taught by the division of stages for the sake of engaging the beginner.

original: las dang po pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams don dam pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams don dam pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mundane beginners enter into the ultimate.

original: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: This method was taught by the perfect Buddha

original: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
analyzed: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
translated: like the steps of a staircase.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa 'ba' zhig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa 'ba' zhig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-intentional is because it is taught only in the stage of union.

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'o zhes pa ni /
translated: The body of the nature of mind.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The body of intuition which is to be attained by the process of self-consecration.üîΩPure by ultimate reality.

original: don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par dag pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bzhi pas so //
translated: The reality of clearlight by the fourth stage.

original: gang gi phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa nyid yongs su spong ba'i don du 'od gsal ba de kho na nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa nyid yongs su spong ba'i don du 'od gsal ba de kho na nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Because of that, the reality of clearlight should be cultivated for the purpose of abandoning the very concept of illusion-like.üîΩThe collection of verses which elucidates that.

original: de gsal bar byed pa'i ngag gi tshogs so zhes pa ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i rim pa rjod par byed pa'i tshogs rnams so //üîΩkun rdzob kyi bden pas so zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang @163a * //
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa'i ngag gi tshogs so zhes pa ni gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i rim pa rjod par byed pa'i tshogs rnams so // kun rdzob kyi bden pas so zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang @163a * //
translated: The collection of verses which expresses the third and fourth stages.üîΩBy conventional reality.

original: bzhin gyi bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i man ngag gis so //
analyzed: bzhin gyi bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'i man ngag gis so //
translated: By the process of self-consecration, which has the nature of the illusion-like meditative concentration.

original: don dam pa'i bden pas so zhes pa ni de rnam par dag par byed pa'i 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pas so zhes pa ni de rnam par dag par byed pa'i 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas so //
translated: By the ultimate truth, by the stage of manifest enlightenment, which has the characteristic of entering into the clear light that purifies those.

original: 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku yang rnam par dag par bya ba yin no zhes bya bas ngo mtshar ba dang rmad du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku yang rnam par dag par bya ba yin no zhes bya bas ngo mtshar ba dang rmad du gyur pa'o //
translated: The body of Great Vajradhara, who acts for the welfare of the world, is also to be purified. Thus, it is wondrous and marvelous.

original: ae ma'o sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don de nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pas don de nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: By the words ‚ÄúAh! The Buddha,‚Äù and so on, that very meaning is taught.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i man ngag gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i man ngag gi sgo nas so //
translated: By the conventional truth, the praise is by means of the esoteric instructions of the self-consecration.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i sgo nas so zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i sgo nas so zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: By the ultimate truth, by means of the teaching of the purification of the mind and manifest enlightenment.

original: bden pa gnyis mi phyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsal bar byed pa'i man ngag gi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis mi phyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsal bar byed pa'i man ngag gi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: The phrase the two truths are inseparable and so forth is a praise from the perspective of the esoteric instructions that clarify the samƒÅdhi of union.

original: 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i sems rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase the clear light is the characteristic of the pure mind that is attained by means of the mantra and mudrƒÅ stages.

original: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku ste zhes pa ni de las byung ba ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sku ste zhes pa ni de las byung ba ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'o //
translated: The phrase the completely pure divine body is the body that is the nature of gnosis that arises from that.

original: des ni rim pa gnyis kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: des ni rim pa gnyis kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: Thus, he praises [the BhagavƒÅn] from the perspective of the two stages.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa las yang dag par 'khrungs zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid las zung du 'jug pa 'byung bas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa las yang dag par 'khrungs zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid las zung du 'jug pa 'byung bas so //
translated: The phrase arises from the ultimate truth is because the union arises from the reality of the clear light that is to be attained by means of the fourth stage.

original: des rim pa bzhi pa dang lnga pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa gnyis so sor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des rim pa bzhi pa dang lnga pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa gnyis so sor bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he teaches the two stages called the fourth and fifth stages individually.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The stage of completion is the nature of the mind of clear light and so forth as previously explained.

original: des ni rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: des ni rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: By that, by the stage of completion,

original: gdul bya rnams bskyed par mdzad pa zhes pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku nyid du rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams bskyed par mdzad pa zhes pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku nyid du rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: he generates the disciples, that is, he causes them to be perfected in the body of Great Vajradhara.

original: des ni rang gis gzigs pa'i de kho na nyid kyi don ston pas na bcom ldan 'das skyob pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des ni rang gis gzigs pa'i de kho na nyid kyi don ston pas na bcom ldan 'das skyob pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, because he teaches the meaning of reality that he himself has seen, he is called the Blessed Protector.

original: rang mthong lam ston skyob pa yin //
analyzed: rang mthong lam ston skyob pa yin //
translated: He is the protector who teaches the path that one sees for oneself.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: des na rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des na rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the perfection of one's own and others' goals is taught.

original: rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa //
translated: He is beyond all thought,

original: zhes pa la chags bral la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la chags bral la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is free from the natures of desirelessness and so forth.

original: dmigs su med pa ste de nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa ste de nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: He is non-apprehensible, that is, he has that special nature.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag tu bzung bas na zhes pa @163b la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa'i phyir kun tu bzang po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag tu bzung bas na zhes pa @163b la mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pa'i phyir kun tu bzang po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do //
translated: Since he is grasped in cyclic existence and in nirvana,Samantabhadra is Great Vajradhara himself, because he has attained the realm of nirvana that does not abide in the extremes of cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ces pa ni rang gi don la sogs pa de'i ngo bo ni de nyid do //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ces pa ni rang gi don la sogs pa de'i ngo bo ni de nyid do //
translated: All perfections are the essence of his own benefit and so forth. His nature is that very nature.

original: lha'i dkyil 'khor spro bar mdzad pas na zhes pa la bran dang bran mo dang pho nya dang pho nya mo dang / bka' nyan dang bka' nyan mo la sogs pa dkyil 'khor pa du ma 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i dkyil 'khor spro bar mdzad pas na zhes pa la bran dang bran mo dang pho nya dang pho nya mo dang / bka' nyan dang bka' nyan mo la sogs pa dkyil 'khor pa du ma 'od zer gyi sbyor bas bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since he emanates the divine mandala, he is the creator of the many mandalas of servants, servant-maids, messengers, female messengers, and so forth, because he generates them by the yoga of light rays.

original: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus he has explained the praise of the BhagavƒÅn abiding in the union samƒÅdhi.

original: byang chub pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la zhes pa rim pa bzhi pa thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la zhes pa rim pa bzhi pa thob par bya ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: Enlightenment is in the ultimate truth, the reality that is to be attained in the fourth stage.

original: de gang gis spyad cing thob par byed pa ni zhes pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'i mos pas man ngag bzhi pa la rnal 'byor pa rnams brtson pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gang gis spyad cing thob par byed pa ni zhes pa la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'i mos pas man ngag bzhi pa la rnal 'byor pa rnams brtson pa byed pa'o //
translated: The one who practices and attains it is the yogi who strives in the fourth esoteric instruction, imagining that he attains the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lha'i sku'i rnam pa bzung ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i lha'i sku'i rnam pa bzung ba'o //
translated: The relative truth is the adoption of the form of the illusion-like divine body.

original: rdo rje ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can te zhes pa la bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do //üîΩdag pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje ni bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can te zhes pa la bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do // dag pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste zhes pa ni /
translated: The vajra is the nature of the two truths is the nature of Great Vajradhara, who is the nature of the two truths.

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum dang / 'dod chags bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs brgya drug cu dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum dang / 'dod chags bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs brgya drug cu dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The pure is the ultimate truth is the reality free from the three intuitions such as vision and so on, and the one hundred and sixty assemblies of the nature of freedom from passion and so on.

original: des ni rim pa gnyis pa gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rim pa gnyis pa gsal bar bstan to //
translated: By that, the second stage is clearly taught.

original: yongs su dag cing yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku zhes pa ni 'ja' tshon dang dri za'i grong khyer dang chu zla la sogs pa sgyu ma'i dpes nye bar mtshon pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa 'od gsal ba la cig car du byung ba'i
analyzed: yongs su dag cing yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku zhes pa ni 'ja' tshon dang dri za'i grong khyer dang chu zla la sogs pa sgyu ma'i dpes nye bar mtshon pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa 'od gsal ba la cig car du byung ba'i
translated: The utterly pure, the body that is the nature of mind, is endowed with the supreme of all aspects, as illustrated by examples such as a rainbow, a city of gandharvas, and the moon in water.üîΩ

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde bzhin nyid du gshegs pas na /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku zhes bya ba'i don to // de bzhin nyid du gshegs pas na /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe body of mind, which is completely pure‚Äù is the body of Great Vajradhara, which is the appearance of the clear light endowed with the supreme of all aspects, illustrated by the examples of the rainbow, the gandharva city, the reflection of the moon in water, and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de bzhin nyid de bden par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de bzhin nyid de bden par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving gone to suchness‚Äù means that the clear light to be attained by the purification of the mind is suchness, because it is the truth.

original: gshegs pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gshegs pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving gone‚Äù means that it is attained by the stages of mantra and mudra.

original: rdo rje gsum la sogs pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sku 'am sems rnam pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku yis so //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum la sogs pa'i rnam par zhes bya ba ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i sku 'am sems rnam pa gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku yis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the body of Great Vajradhara, which is the three vajras and so forth‚Äù means that it is by the body of Great Vajradhara, which is the body of the three vajras, such as the vajra body, and so forth, which is the nature of the three aspects of the mind.

original: gdul bya rnams la snang bas so //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams la snang bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTo the disciples‚Äù means to the disciples who are to be tamed.üîΩ‚ÄúBy the appearance‚Äù means by the appearance of the body of Great Vajradhara.

original: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la rang gi sku gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi @164a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa'i sems can rnams la rang gi sku gsal bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro // mi @164a * //
translated: This is because he illuminates the sentient beings who dwell in the three realms with his own body.

original: gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la mngon par byang chub pa thob pa'i 'og tu zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jog pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la mngon par byang chub pa thob pa'i 'og tu zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jog pa'i don to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúabide‚Äù is to be placed in the samƒÅdhi of union after attaining manifest enlightenment in the dhƒÅtu of nonabiding nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: des ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rnams bstan to //
translated: This teaches the stages of the pure mind, the self-consecration, the manifest enlightenment, and the union.

original: sgra ji bzhin par bshad pa zhes pa ni bstod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin par bshad pa zhes pa ni bstod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation of the words just as they are is for the purpose of teaching the meaning of the characteristics of praise.

original: de yang sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa lnga ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos rjes su zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa lnga ni rdo rje 'chang chen pos rjes su zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
translated: Here, the five verses are spoken by the tathƒÅgatas who have entered after MahƒÅvajradhara.

original: gzhan du na rdo rje 'chang chen po ston pa yin pas gzhan rnams kyis chos ston par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na rdo rje 'chang chen po ston pa yin pas gzhan rnams kyis chos ston par mi rigs so //
translated: Otherwise, since Great Vajradhara is the teacher, it would be illogical for others to teach the doctrine.

original: la la na re rdo rje 'chang chen po longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo yin la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin yin no zhes longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po khoüîΩnas gsungs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la na re rdo rje 'chang chen po longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo yin la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin yin no zhes longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po kho nas gsungs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Great Vajradhara is the essence of the enjoyment body and the transcendent ones are the nature of the emanation body, but since the enjoyment body and emanation body are inseparable, Great Vajradhara alone teaches the Dharma.

original: dbyer med yang 'gro ba'i don du gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyer med yang 'gro ba'i don du gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are inseparable because they are the same in terms of the benefit of migrating beings.

original: byang chub kyi sems rab tu ston pa zhes pa la byang chub sems ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rab tu ston pa zhes pa la byang chub sems ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su stong pa nyid do //
translated: The teaching of bodhicitta refers to emptiness in the context of the stage of generating bodhicitta.

original: de gsal bar byed pas na byang chub kyi sems rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pas na byang chub kyi sems rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: Since it illuminates that, it is the teaching of bodhicitta.

original: de nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lngas thob par bya ba'i stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lngas thob par bya ba'i stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ngo bo rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Then, in the direction of the completion stage, the state of Great Vajradhara, the essence of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion to be attained by the five stages such as vajra repetition, is the thought of awakening.

original: de gsal bar byed pas na byang chub kyi sems rab tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pas na byang chub kyi sems rab tu ston pa'o //
translated: Since it illuminates that, it is the illumination of the thought of awakening.

original: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa'i //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje dbyer med pa'i //
translated: The inseparability of emptiness and compassion

original: byang chub sems zhes bshad pa yin //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bshad pa yin //
translated: is explained as the thought of awakening.

original: zhes rgyud phyi ma las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes rgyud phyi ma las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is from the Later Tantra.

original: le'u'i sgra'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: le'u'i sgra'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the word chapter has been explained above.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter of the commentary that illuminates the lamp.

original: // / rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha'i le'u gsum pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha'i le'u gsum pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: The third chapter, the chapter on the deity, is taught by the words ‚Äútwo types of yogis‚Äù and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u las stong pa nyid thob nas de nas bskyed pa'i rim pas lha'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u las stong pa nyid thob nas de nas bskyed pa'i rim pas lha'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Because, in the chapter on the Thought of Enlightenment, having attained emptiness, then by the stage of creation one should meditate on the circle of deities.

original: de bzhin du dang po sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba @164b mchog yongs su rdzogs nas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gsal bar bya ba'i phyir phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba @164b mchog yongs su rdzogs nas las kyi rgyal ba mchog gsal bar bya ba'i phyir phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, having completed the first union and the mandala of the supreme victor, in order to illuminate the supreme victor of action, one should meditate on the subtle yoga.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: In order that the yoga of the perfection stage should meditate on the subtle yoga, the stage of vajra repetition should be taught.

original: rnal 'byor pa gnyis kyi ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba dag gis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gnyis kyi ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor ba dag gis so //
translated: Of the two yogis, of those who are yogis of the creation and perfection stages.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa gnyis bya'o zhes pa la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje la sogs pa phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rigs kyi dbye bas gsang ba dang snying ga dang gdong gi sna rtser phra mo'i thig le bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa gnyis bya'o zhes pa la bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje la sogs pa phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi rigs kyi dbye bas gsang ba dang snying ga dang gdong gi sna rtser phra mo'i thig le bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yoga of the subtle drop is the yoga of the drop of the nature of desire, hatred, and ignorance, which is practiced at the secret place, the heart, and the tip of the nose.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pas stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi rtsa'i khong stong nas rgyu ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rdo rje nor bu'i rtse'am //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pas stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi rtsa'i khong stong nas rgyu ba'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le rdo rje nor bu'i rtse'am //
translated: The yoga of the drop of the nature of desire is the yoga of the drop of bodhicitta, which is the size of a mustard seed, and is practiced at the tip of the vajra jewel or at the tip of the lotus center.üîΩThe yoga of the drop of the nature of hatred is the yoga of the drop of bodhicitta, which is the size of a sesame seed, and is practiced at the tip of the heart.

original: padma'i lte ba'i rtser yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi thig le bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i lte ba'i rtser yungs kar gyi 'bru'i tshad tsam gyi thig le bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yoga of the drop of the nature of ignorance is the yoga of the drop of bodhicitta, which is the size of a barley grain, and is practiced at the tip of the nose.

original: zhe sdang gi rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas yi ge gsum cha shas bsdus nas thugs rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon gyi thig le tsam snying gar dmigs la sngags kyi thig le bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas yi ge gsum cha shas bsdus nas thugs rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon gyi thig le tsam snying gar dmigs la sngags kyi thig le bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yogin of the type of hatred, having combined the three syllables, should visualize the mere drop of the seed of Cittavajra at the heart, and should meditate on the drop of mantra.

original: gti mug gi rigs can gyis dkyil 'khor bzhi po las g-yas dang g-yon dang dman pa dang dal bus rgyu ba'i dbye bas spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kun rdzob kyi sna rtser thig le'i gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi rigs can gyis dkyil 'khor bzhi po las g-yas dang g-yon dang dman pa dang dal bus rgyu ba'i dbye bas spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kun rdzob kyi sna rtser thig le'i gzugs bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The one of the type of delusion should meditate on the form of the drop at the tip of the relative nose, from the four ma·πá·∏çalas, by the division of the right, left, inferior, and slow moving rays of light.

original: de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag gis kyang smin mtshams dang lte ba'i dkyil du thig le bsgom par bya ba ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag gis kyang smin mtshams dang lte ba'i dkyil du thig le bsgom par bya ba ni phra mo'i rnal 'byor rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the yogins of Ratnasa·πÉbhava and Amoghasiddhi should meditate on the drop at the point between the eyebrows and at the navel, respectively. This is to be understood as the subtle yoga.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni zhes pa la phung po lnga dang de rnams bsdu bar byed pa sku la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni zhes pa la phung po lnga dang de rnams bsdu bar byed pa sku la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the TathƒÅgatas means the five aggregates and their compilers, the body, etc.

original: de dag nye bar sdud par byed pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nye bar sdud par byed pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste drug pa'o //
translated: The vajra of body, speech, and mind is the sixth, Great Vajradhara, because he gathers them all together.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste phyag rgya legs par sbyang ba'i sngon du 'gro bar phyung ba'i sngags kyi rim pas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor spros la lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste phyag rgya legs par sbyang ba'i sngon du 'gro bar phyung ba'i sngags kyi rim pas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa'i dkyil 'khor spros la lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can
translated: All the Tathagatas are Akshobhya and so forth.  Having previously trained in the mudra, by the process of the mantra, he emanates the mandala of the pledge and the mandala of the accomplishment, and the thirty-two deities,

original: gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' @165a * //
analyzed: gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' @165a * //
translated: the Tathagatas, the goddesses, the Bodhisattvas,

original: dang khro bo rnams so //
analyzed: dang khro bo rnams so //
translated: and the wrathful ones.

original: de rnams kyis sems can gyi don gyi phyir zhes pa ni de dag gis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis sems can gyi don gyi phyir zhes pa ni de dag gis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings means that they perform the welfare of the world.

original: phyogs bcur khyab pa zhes pa la reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung ba'i nang nas phyi rol du spros te mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'jug par bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcur gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcur khyab pa zhes pa la reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung ba'i nang nas phyi rol du spros te mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'jug par bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcur gshegs pa'o //
translated: The pervading the ten directions is the emission outside from the inner of the dharmodaya of the Vajra Touch, in order to enter the Buddha-fields of Abhirati and so on.

original: de nyid ni chos kyi char 'bebs pas na zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te //
analyzed: de nyid ni chos kyi char 'bebs pas na zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te //
translated: And that very (emission) is pouring down the rain of Dharma, and so on, which is just an illustration.

original: brtan pa dang smin pa dang grol ba dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa dang smin pa dang grol ba dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also the maturation of the stable, the liberation, and the entry into the Buddha-fields.

original: de nyid ni sems can bsam pa sna tshogs pas phye ba la zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyis sems can gyi bsam pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bud med dang skyes pa'i dbye bas spro ba dang zhi ba dang drag po'i gzugs dang
analyzed: de nyid ni sems can bsam pa sna tshogs pas phye ba la zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams kyis sems can gyi bsam pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bud med dang skyes pa'i dbye bas spro ba dang zhi ba dang drag po'i gzugs dang
translated: And that very (emission) is the various wishes of sentient beings, which means that it is emitted by those of the type of passion and so on, following the wishes of sentient beings, in the forms of female and male, peaceful and wrathful, and so on.

original: sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams dang ldan pa'i sku'i dbye bas kyang spro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: sgeg pa la sogs pa'i nyams dang ldan pa'i sku'i dbye bas kyang spro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: The meaning of expansion is the expansion by the division of the body endowed with the moods of grace, etc.

original: sku du mar ston pa'i phyir bkod pa'o zhes pa ni zhal gsum pa la sogs pa dang rigs sna tshogs pa'i rang gi sku bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku du mar ston pa'i phyir bkod pa'o zhes pa ni zhal gsum pa la sogs pa dang rigs sna tshogs pa'i rang gi sku bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of array is because of showing many bodies, because of showing one's body in the form of three faces, etc., and in the various clans.

original: gang gi phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po gcig pu kho na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin na yang kha dog lnga dang zhi ba dang drag po dang pho dang mo'i dbye bas rab tu snang ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdo rje 'chang chen po gcig pu kho na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yin na yang kha dog lnga dang zhi ba dang drag po dang pho dang mo'i dbye bas rab tu snang ste /
translated: Although only the one Great Vajradhara is of the nature of the Dharma Realm, he appears as five colors, peaceful, fierce, male, and female.

original: de don dam par dbye ba ni med de //
analyzed: de don dam par dbye ba ni med de //
translated: The ultimate division of him is not existent,

original: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of being of the nature of clear light.

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
