translated: In such a way, etc. means because of the characteristics of the first application, etc.

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa la rdo rje bzhin du me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa la rdo rje bzhin du me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes rnams kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra is the Tathagatas. It is so called because, like a vajra, they are indivisible by the mirror-like knowledge, etc.

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te des na de'i rigs las byung ba'i lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams kyang gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te des na de'i rigs las byung ba'i lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams kyang gzung ngo //
translated: Here the word Tathagata is a synecdoche, and so it includes the goddesses, Bodhisattvas, and wrathful deities who are born of his clan.

original: de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gzhi'i le'u zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gzhi'i le'u zhes bya ba la //
translated: This is the chapter on the ground of the samadhi called ‚Äúvajra-like.‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin ni gzhi can no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni gzhi can no //
translated: The samadhi is the ground.

original: le'u ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: le'u ni gzhi'o //
translated: The chapter is the ground.

original: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi dbyer med par byas nas ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gzhi dang gzhi can gyi dbyer med par byas nas ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u zhes bstan te /
translated: The chapter is taught as the samadhi ground, by making the ground and the ground-possessor inseparable.

original: tshem bu du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tshem bu du ba bzhin no //
translated: Like a cloth and its design.

original: tshem bu la gnas pa'i bu chung du ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshem bu la gnas pa'i bu chung du ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u'i ming don dang ldan pas bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u'i ming don dang ldan pas bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows that the chapter‚Äôs name is appropriate.

original: lha rnams bskyed pa'i yan lag dag tu gyur pa'i gsang sngags dang @165b por ston pa ni zhes pa la dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa brtan par byed pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: lha rnams bskyed pa'i yan lag dag tu gyur pa'i gsang sngags dang @165b por ston pa ni zhes pa la dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phyogs gcig pa stong pa nyid bsgom pa brtan par byed pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: The mantra that is the branch of generating the deities is taught by ‚Äúand so forth.‚Äù

original: kyi sngags dang po bstan par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kyi sngags dang po bstan par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mantra that is the branch of the first yoga samƒÅdhi, which is the one-sided yoga of meditating on emptiness, should be taught.

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms pa'i 'og tu sngags 'di brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms pa'i 'og tu sngags 'di brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúo·πÉ‚Äù and so forth is that after meditating on the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala, this mantra should be recited.

analyzed: chos 'byung ba la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni bgegs bskrad pa dang stong pa nyid bsgoms pa'i 'og tu yi ge h'um gi sa bon las bskyed pa'i gzhi'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin gyi chos 'byung gi phyag rgya'i steng du yi shes kyi sa gzhi 'byung ba chen
translated: ‚ÄúResiding in the source of phenomena‚Äù means that after expelling obstructors and meditating on emptiness, the source of phenomena, which is the nature of the basic ma·πá·∏çala generated from the seed syllable h≈´·πÉ, is the mudra of the source of phenomena.

original: po bzhi'i rang bzhin dang ri rab yongs su gyur pa las //
analyzed: po bzhi'i rang bzhin dang ri rab yongs su gyur pa las //
translated: The nature of the four elements and Mount Meru transform into

analyzed: rin chen sna bdun gyi gzhal yas khang pa'i nang na sna tshogs padma dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor du skad cig gis rdzogs pa'i lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bsgom pa la /
translated: a celestial mansion of the seven precious substances, with a multicolored lotus, moon, and sun ma·πá·∏çala, instantly complete with the thirty-two deities.

analyzed: de nyid rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa'i gzugs phung gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor du byas la /
translated: In the ma·πá·∏çala of imagination, the form aggregate is the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala, as stated in the Vajra Pa√±jarƒÅ:üîΩThe form aggregate is the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala.

original: yab yum ro gcig par gyur nas sngags 'dir brtan par byas te /
analyzed: yab yum ro gcig par gyur nas sngags 'dir brtan par byas te /
translated: The father and mother become of one taste and stabilize the mantra.üîΩAgain, from the three syllables, upon a lotus, moon, and sun, the three syllables transform into a moon ma·πá·∏çala, upon which the previous lotus and so on enter.

original: yang yi ge gsum las byung ba'i padma dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i steng du yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la snga ma'i padma la sogs pa gsum zhugs te chos kyi dbyings kyi sngags kyis rang gi sems brtan par byas la
analyzed: yang yi ge gsum las byung ba'i padma dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i steng du yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la snga ma'i padma la sogs pa gsum zhugs te chos kyi dbyings kyi sngags kyis rang gi sems brtan par byas la
translated: The mantra of the dharmadhƒÅtu stabilizes one‚Äôs mind.

original: / de'i steng du yi ge gsum rnam par bkod la de nas spro ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro bar rdo rje bskyed la //
analyzed: / de'i steng du yi ge gsum rnam par bkod la de nas spro ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro bar rdo rje bskyed la //
translated: Above that, arrange the three seed syllables, and then, having first emanated and reabsorbed, generate the vajra.

analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i lha'i 'khor lo gang yang rung ba rnam par bsgoms te / ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dgod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rjes su rnal 'byor byas la phung po dang khams dang skye mched la yig 'bru dgod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shin tu rnal 'byor rdzogs nas sku la sogs pa la byin gyis brlab pa'i
translated: From that, having meditated on any of the divine wheels such as Great Vajradhara,

original: rnal 'byor chen po byas te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po byas te /
translated: having performed the yoga of the defining characteristics of the placement of the gnosis being and the concentration being, having completed the utter yoga of the defining characteristics of the placement of the seed syllables on the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres, having performed the great yoga of the consecration of the body, and so on,

analyzed: phyag rgya 'dus nas reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung gi nang du phyung ba'i sngags kyis dkyil 'khor pa rnams sprul te /
translated: having gathered the mudras, having emanated the mandala deities from within the phenomena source of Sparshavajra,

analyzed: de las phyi rol du spros la 'gro ba'i don byas nas slar yang @166a * //
translated: having emanated them externally, having performed the welfare of migrating beings, having again gathered them,

analyzed: gshegs te / shar la sogs pa'i phyogs dang mtshams su dkyil 'khor pa rnams rim gyis bzhugs par bsams la /

analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang rgyas btab cing de'i 'og tu 'chad par 'gyur ba'i las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should confer the empowerment, seal, and then meditate on the subtle yoga of the branch of meditative concentration of the supreme victor of action, which will be explained below.

analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi 'khor lo zhes smos te /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚Äúthe wheel of the deities such as Vairocana.‚Äù

analyzed: yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i 'khor lo'i phyag mtshan las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi sprul pa'i lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the wheel of the thirty-two emanation deities of Vairocana, arisen from the wheel hand implement arisen from the transformation of the three syllables, is called the ‚Äúwheel.‚Äù

original: rigs dang der 'brel ba'i lha rnams te zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs kyi 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i lha rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs dang der 'brel ba'i lha rnams te zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs kyi 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i lha rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The families and the deities connected with them means the deities connected with the families of Vairochana and so forth.

original: de nyid gnas ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par gnas pas na zhes pa la shar phyogs la sogs pa'i gnas la nye bar bkod pas so //
analyzed: de nyid gnas ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par gnas pas na zhes pa la shar phyogs la sogs pa'i gnas la nye bar bkod pas so //
translated: They are arranged in their respective places means that they are placed in the east and so forth.

original: rang gi bdag po'i sku mdog dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa ni dbus kyi gtso bo la ltos pas dbus kyi sa'i cha ni bdag po dang mtshungs pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi bdag po'i sku mdog dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa ni dbus kyi gtso bo la ltos pas dbus kyi sa'i cha ni bdag po dang mtshungs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: They are the same color as their respective lords means that the central part is the same color as the central lord.

original: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi sa'i cha ni dkar po'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi sa'i cha ni dkar po'o //
translated: Thus, the central part of the mandala of Vairochana is white.

original: shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi sa'i cha rnams ni nag po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang ljang gu'o //
analyzed: shar dang lho dang nub dang byang gi sa'i cha rnams ni nag po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang ljang gu'o //
translated: The parts of the earth in the east, south, west and north are black, yellow, red and green.

original: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi sa'i cha ni kha dog nag po dang shar la sogs pa dkar po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang ljang gu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi sa'i cha ni kha dog nag po dang shar la sogs pa dkar po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang ljang gu'o //
translated: In the same way, the central part of the mandala of Akshobhya is black, and the east, etc., are white, yellow, red, and green.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi sa'i cha ni ser po dang / shar la sogs pa dkar po dang nag po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'o //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi sa'i cha ni ser po dang / shar la sogs pa dkar po dang nag po dang / dmar po dang / ljang gu'o //
translated: In the mandala of Ratnasambhava, the central part is yellow, and the east, etc., are white, black, red, and green.

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi sa'i cha ni dmar po dang shar la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus kyi sa'i cha ni dmar po dang shar la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the mandala of Amitabha, the central part is red, and the east, etc., are as before.

original: 'on kyang nub ni nag po'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nub ni nag po'o //
translated: However, the west is black.

original: don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i cha ni ljang gu dang ; shar la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i cha ni ljang gu dang ; shar la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: In the mandala of Amoghasiddhi, the central part is green, and the east, etc., are as before.

original: 'on kyang byang ni nag po'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang byang ni nag po'o //
translated: However, the north is black.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas spyan ma nas brtsams te gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po'i bar du lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa gnyis su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas spyan ma nas brtsams te gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po'i bar du lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor sum cu rtsa gnyis su shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, beginning with BuddhalocanƒÅ, one should know the thirty-two deities as the thirty-two ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: de rnams mdor bsdus na stong phrag gcig dang nyi shu rtsa @166b bzhi'i lha rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams mdor bsdus na stong phrag gcig dang nyi shu rtsa @166b bzhi'i lha rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: In brief, they become the deities of one thousand and twenty-four.

original: de rnams bdag po la ltos te gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams bdag po la ltos te gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
translated: They should be arranged in their respective places in dependence on the principal one.

original: kha dog sna lnga'i sa'i cha dang ldan pa'o zhes pa la /
analyzed: kha dog sna lnga'i sa'i cha dang ldan pa'o zhes pa la /
translated: It has the parts of the five-colored earth.

original: bdag po la ltos te shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po la ltos te shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In dependence on the principal one, it has the five colors in the east and so on.

original: thams cad du bzang po'i zhes pa ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: thams cad du bzang po'i zhes pa ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi khyad par ro //
translated: ‚Äú Everywhere good‚Äù is the special inner ma·πá·∏çala.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ni gru bzhi pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor ni gru bzhi pa nyid do //
translated: The outer ma·πá·∏çala is square.

original: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni lha'i snam bu dang dra ba phyed pa dang rin po che'i pha gu dang pa nytsa r'a ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni lha'i snam bu dang dra ba phyed pa dang rin po che'i pha gu dang pa nytsa r'a ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the vajra of form, etc. means endowed with the gods' platforms, half-garlands, jewel-beams, and cintamani-gems.

original: lha la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa'i mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang bcas pa'o zhes pa la /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa'i mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang bcas pa'o zhes pa la /
translated: Along with the fivefold worship of the gods, etc.

original: shin tu dad pa las 'ongs pa'i brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha'i tshogs kyi lag pas 'bul ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu dad pa las 'ongs pa'i brgya byin la sogs pa'i lha'i tshogs kyi lag pas 'bul ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means along with the worship of various kinds offered by the hosts of gods such as Indra, who come with great faith, with their hands.

original: mdor na zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: mdor na zhes pa ni sngar bshad pa'i bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
translated: In brief, means by the previously explained creation stage.

original: lha'i 'khor lo 'di ltar bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas bskyed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i lha'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i 'khor lo 'di ltar bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas bskyed pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i lha'i 'khor lo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This wheel of gods should be imagined means that one should meditate on the wheel of gods such as the Tathagata, created by means of the samadhi of the mandala of the Supreme Victor.

original: bdag nyid ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo las logs su bdag nyid kyang tha dad par bsgom par mi bya'i /
analyzed: bdag nyid ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo las logs su bdag nyid kyang tha dad par bsgom par mi bya'i /
translated: One should not meditate on oneself as separate from the mandala circle, but

original: 'on kyang dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rang bzhin du bzhugs par bdag nyid bsam par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i rang bzhin du bzhugs par bdag nyid bsam par bya ba'i don to //
translated: rather as existing in the nature of the lord of the mandala.

original: 'khor lo'i dkyil du zhes pa la lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi lha'i 'khor lo'i dbus su'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dkyil du zhes pa la lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi lha'i 'khor lo'i dbus su'o //
translated: In the center of the circle means in the center of the circle of the thirty-two deities.

original: bdag por gyur pa nyid kyis gzhag go zhes pa ni rnal 'byor bzhis bdag nyid kyi dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag por gyur pa nyid kyis gzhag go zhes pa ni rnal 'byor bzhis bdag nyid kyi dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should be placed by the lord means that one should be placed by the yoga of the first concentration, which is oneself.

original: skad kyi byings brjod pa ni don du ma yin pas bsgom pa'i sgra ni gzhag pa'i don la 'jug go //
analyzed: skad kyi byings brjod pa ni don du ma yin pas bsgom pa'i sgra ni gzhag pa'i don la 'jug go //
translated: Since the verbal root bhƒÅ·π£ means many things, the word bhƒÅvanƒÅ is used in the sense of placing.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po la rjes su 'jug pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po la rjes su 'jug pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. shows the meditation on the great seal of Vairochana, etc. by entering into Great Vajradhara.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po ni /
translated: Because the Blessed One, Great Vajradhara,

original: shes pa dang shes bya nye bar bsdus pa'i ngo bo chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya nye bar bsdus pa'i ngo bo chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: is the nature of the reality of all phenomena, the essence that includes knowledge and objects of knowledge.

original: de bas na des byin gyis brlabs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs ster par 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan du na brtag par bya ba tsam de rnams kyi @167a * //
analyzed: de bas na des byin gyis brlabs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams kyis bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs ster par 'gyur ro // gzhan du na brtag par bya ba tsam de rnams kyi @167a * //
translated: Therefore, the bodies of the Tathagatas, blessed by him, bestow the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: 'bras bu gang yang ster bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yang ster bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, that mere object of investigation would not bestow any result of them.

original: de la rjes su zhugs pa'i lha'i sku brtags pa yang yongs su dag pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rjes su zhugs pa'i lha'i sku brtags pa yang yongs su dag pa'i skur 'gyur ro //
translated: The imagined divine body that is engaged in that becomes a purified body.

original: de nyid kyi phyir le'u bcu gsum pa las kyang //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir le'u bcu gsum pa las kyang //
translated: For that very reason, in the thirteenth chapter it is said:

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rgyal po che //
translated: Great king Vajrasattva

original: yang dang yang du bskul bar bya //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bskul bar bya //
translated: should be invoked again and again.

original: de ni sngags rnams thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de ni sngags rnams thams cad kyi //
translated: He is the king of all mantras,

original: rgyal po rtag pa mchog yin no //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal po rtag pa mchog yin no // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the eternal supreme one.

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang //
translated: And in the Prakriti it is said:

original: de ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: de ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
translated: He is the self-arisen Blessed One,

original: gcig pu'i bdag nyid che ba'i lha //
analyzed: gcig pu'i bdag nyid che ba'i lha //
translated: The great god of one nature,

original: man ngag rnams ni rab ster bas //
analyzed: man ngag rnams ni rab ster bas //
translated: Who bestows the esoteric instructions.

original: rdo rje slob dpon de bas lhag / ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon de bas lhag / ces 'byung ngo //
translated: The vajra master is greater than he.

original: rdo rje 'chang gi sprul pa yi //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi sprul pa yi // zhes pa ni /
translated: The emanation of Vajradhara,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos bskyed cing /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos bskyed cing /
translated: is generated by Great Vajradhara,

original: de la rjes su zhugs te de'i rnam pa nyid du 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su zhugs te de'i rnam pa nyid du 'gyur pa'o //
translated: and by entering into him, he becomes of that very nature.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid 'jig rten pa 'di ji srid de dag thams cad rdo rje 'chang ba las bskyed cing de nyid du thim mo //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid 'jig rten pa 'di ji srid de dag thams cad rdo rje 'chang ba las bskyed cing de nyid du thim mo //
translated: As long as this world, with its moving and unmoving beings, is generated from Vajradhara and dissolves into him,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as is said:

original: pha rol 'gro ba kha cig gang //
analyzed: pha rol 'gro ba kha cig gang //
translated: Some who go to the other side

original: rtags kyi dbye bas rnam par gnas //
analyzed: rtags kyi dbye bas rnam par gnas //
translated: Are situated by the division of signs.

original: de rnams kyang 'dis smod mi bya //üîΩrdo rje sems dpas sprul pa yin //
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'dis smod mi bya // rdo rje sems dpas sprul pa yin //
translated: They also should not be disparaged by him,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: For they are emanations of Vajrasattva.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni thams cad la //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni thams cad la //
translated: In all the realms of space

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dpal ldan bzhugs /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dpal ldan bzhugs /
translated: Vajrasattva, the glorious one, resides.

original: zhes bde mchog las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bde mchog las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is from the Cakrasa·πÉvara Tantra.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i lhag par mos pas /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i lhag par mos pas /
translated: The great seal of Vairocana is the imagination of Great Vajradhara.

original: bsgom pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe body of the cultivated Vairocana, etc.‚Äù is that.

original: sku rdo rje nyid du gyur pa yin yang //
analyzed: sku rdo rje nyid du gyur pa yin yang //
translated: Even though he is the very essence of the vajra body,

original: zhes pa ni sku rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: he is the very essence of the purified body.

original: yon tan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang mnga' bas zhes pa ni nang du chud pa'i gsung dang thugs kyi nus pas so //
analyzed: yon tan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang mnga' bas zhes pa ni nang du chud pa'i gsung dang thugs kyi nus pas so //
translated: He also has the nature of the qualities, because of the power of speech and mind that are included within him.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ni sku rdo rje rnam par dag pa yin par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ni sku rdo rje rnam par dag pa yin par ma zad kyi /
translated: For what reason is the Lord Vairocana not only the purified vajra body,

original: 'on kyang gsung dang thugs rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsung dang thugs rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yang yin no //
translated: but also the very essence of the purified speech and mind?

original: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa'i cha gcig gis mtshan gyi tha snyad bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa'i cha gcig gis mtshan gyi tha snyad bya ba yin te /
translated: For that very reason, he is designated by the name ‚Äúchief of the Tathagatas.‚Äù

original: dper na snying rje'i rang bzhin 'jig rten dbang phyug bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snying rje'i rang bzhin 'jig rten dbang phyug bzhin no //
translated: For example, Avalokitesvara is the nature of compassion.

original: de la snying rje gcig pu yod kyi shes rab la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gzhan med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la snying rje gcig pu yod kyi shes rab la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gzhan med pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that he has only compassion and no other Buddha qualities such as wisdom.

original: gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang ldan pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yin @167b no ;
analyzed: gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang ldan pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yin @167b no ;
translated: All Buddhas and Bodhisattvas have the principal and secondary Buddha qualities.

original: / dper na zhi ba'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad yin no zhes zhi ba tsam gyi ngo bo yang ma yin te /
analyzed: / dper na zhi ba'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad yin no zhes zhi ba tsam gyi ngo bo yang ma yin te /
translated: For example, Vairocana is the nature of peace, but he is not just the essence of peace,

original: rgyas pa la sogs pa yang mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyas pa la sogs pa yang mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he also performs the acts of enrichment, etc.

original: de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, Ratnasa·πÉbhava, etc., should be understood as the nature of enrichment, etc.

original: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang bag chags dang rigs kyi dbye bas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dmigs te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang bag chags dang rigs kyi dbye bas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtso bor gyur pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dmigs te /
translated: The qualities of the buddhas are considered in terms of their being the principal qualities that correspond to the different dispositions, latent propensities, habitual tendencies and potential of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: The Bhagavat, having observed the differences in the qualities of sentient beings, their inclinations, their latent predispositions, and their lineages, taught the natures of the Tathagatas, Bodhisattvas, and so on, in accordance with those.

original: de bzhin du me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa re re la yod na yang mos pa'i dbye bas ye shes re re'i rang bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa re re la yod na yang mos pa'i dbye bas ye shes re re'i rang bzhin du bstan to //
translated: Similarly, although each of the five wisdoms such as mirror wisdom exists in Vairochana and so on, they are taught as the nature of each wisdom due to the differences in inclination.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med pa mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i rim pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang thob pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bar chod med de gang gis de rnams re res ming thob pa
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med pa mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i rim pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang thob pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bar chod med de gang gis de rnams re res ming thob pa
translated: The Tathagatas, who have attained the state of perfect buddhahood through the five stages of manifest enlightenment, which are free from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, have no obstacles, by which they each attain their names.

original: yin gyi tshang pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi tshang pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the ordinary man.

original: las dang po pa 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rim gyis ye shes thob pa yin no zhes me long lta bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: las dang po pa 'jug par bya ba'i phyir rim gyis ye shes thob pa yin no zhes me long lta bu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: The mirror-like knowledge and so on are taught as the nature of the knowledge, because the knowledge is attained gradually in order to engage the beginner.

original: chos dang chos min dka' thub stong //
analyzed: chos dang chos min dka' thub stong //
translated: Dharma, non-Dharma, empty asceticism,üîΩrestraint, strict restraint, discipline,üîΩanimals, hell-beings, hungry ghosts,üîΩgods, humans, teachers, disciples,

original: bsdams dang nges bsdams 'dul ba dang // dud 'gro dmyal ba yi dags dang // lha dang bcas pa'i mi rnams dang // ston pa dang ni nyan thos dang // thams cad de dag kun rdzob ston //

analyzed: las dang po yi 'jig rten pa //

analyzed: don dam pa la 'jug pa'i phyir //

original: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //

original: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
analyzed: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //

original: de ltar byis pa'i smra ba 'di //
analyzed: de ltar byis pa'i smra ba 'di //

analyzed: mthar ni thams cad 'jig par 'gyur //

original: brjod du med cing brjod med pa'i //
analyzed: brjod du med cing brjod med pa'i //

original: gang yang de nyid snang ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang de nyid snang ba'o //
translated: is the appearance of reality.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sku gsung thugs kyi rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yang gdul bya'i dbang gis ngo bo gcig yin no zhes bstan to //

translated: Therefore, the nature of the purity of the body, speech, and mind of all the TathƒÅgatas is also one essence by the power of those to be trained.

original: rgyu du ma tshogs pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu gang las de ma thag tu skyes pa de des ming gi tha snyad du byas te /
analyzed: rgyu du ma tshogs pa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu gang las de ma thag tu skyes pa de des ming gi tha snyad du byas te /
translated: The effect that arises from the collection of many causes is named after that from which it arises immediately.

original: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du gang la dmigs nas rnam par dag pa 'byung ba gang yin @168a * //

analyzed: pa de ; de'i ming gis bstan pa yin te /

original: dper na sku rdo rje dang gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sku rdo rje dang gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje la sogs pa bzhin no //

analyzed: 'di la lha rnams kyi 'khor lo bsdus pas na zhes pa la /
translated: Here, the wheel of the deities is included, and thus

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad yongs su bsdu bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo thams cad yongs su bsdu bar 'gyur te ;

translated: Because the wheel of the ma·πá·∏çala of the aggregates and so forth dissolves into the body of Great Vajradhara, which is to be attained by means of the stage of union.

original: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the two truths are nondual.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te //
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te //

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i khams gsum pa yang de la thim par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i khams gsum pa yang de la thim par 'gyur te /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog sna tshogs pa'i //

original: ji srid sprin ni du ma rnams //
analyzed: ji srid sprin ni du ma rnams //
translated: Clouds, however many there are,

analyzed: nam mkha'i khams las byung nas ni //

original: de nyid du ni thim par 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid du ni thim par 'gyur //

original: de bzhin rang bzhin thams cad ni //
analyzed: de bzhin rang bzhin thams cad ni //
translated: In the same way, all natures

original: snang ba gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa //
analyzed: snang ba gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa //
translated: Are the cause of the three appearances.

original: ma lus yul la zhugs nas ni //
analyzed: ma lus yul la zhugs nas ni //
translated: Having entered the object without exception,

original: 'od gsal bar ni 'jug par 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'od gsal bar ni 'jug par 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: They enter into clear light.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo las kyang //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo las kyang //
translated: And in the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tra:

original: skra rtse gcig las sangs rgyas du ma ni //üîΩgang g'a'i bye ma snyed dang mtshungs pa ste //
analyzed: skra rtse gcig las sangs rgyas du ma ni // gang g'a'i bye ma snyed dang mtshungs pa ste //
translated: are in a single hair-tip.

original: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: On a single atom, buddhas as numerous as the atoms

original: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'o //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus na bzhugs pa'o // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: are in the midst of the sons of the buddhas.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku zhes pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku zhes pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: The body of Great Vajradhara is the sixth.

original: de dang lhan cig tu sbyor ba zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig ni ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bsgoms pa'i 'og tu rang gi thugs ka nas mi bskyod pa spros te //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu sbyor ba zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig ni ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs la rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bsgoms pa'i 'og tu rang gi thugs ka nas mi bskyod pa spros te //
translated: The union with that is the first union. One part of the samadhi of the first union is the perfection of samadhi. After meditating on the body of Great Vajradhara, Akshobhya is emanated from one's heart.

original: des 'gro ba'i don byas la de dang lhan cig dus gcig tu gyur nas mi bskyod rdo rjer bdag nyid bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des 'gro ba'i don byas la de dang lhan cig dus gcig tu gyur nas mi bskyod rdo rjer bdag nyid bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He performs the welfare of beings. At the same time as that, one should meditate on oneself as Akshobhya Vajra. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. teaches the samadhis of Ratnasambhava and so forth.üîΩ üîΩThe samadhi of Amoghasiddhi is taught by the samadhi of Amoghasiddhi is like that.

original: sku mdog ces bya ba la sogs pas zhe sdang rdo rje la sogs pa'i sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang nyams dang rnam par dag pa bstan te /
analyzed: sku mdog ces bya ba la sogs pas zhe sdang rdo rje la sogs pa'i sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang nyams dang rnam par dag pa bstan te /
translated: The line the color of the body and so forth teaches the color of the body, the hand implements, the mood, and the purity of Hatred Vajra and so forth.

original: khro ba dang 'dod chags chen po 'dres par gyur pas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khro ba dang 'dod chags chen po 'dres par gyur pas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The line the mood of great passion and wrath means that the great yoga tantra is the nature of the purity of passion and hatred.

original: de la mche @168b ba cung zad gtsigs pa'o zhes pa ni khro bo'i nyams dang ldan pa dang reg bya rdo rje mas 'khyud pa chags pa'i ro dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: de la mche @168b ba cung zad gtsigs pa'o zhes pa ni khro bo'i nyams dang ldan pa dang reg bya rdo rje mas 'khyud pa chags pa'i ro dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: The line the fangs slightly bared teaches the mood of wrath and the embrace of the Vajra of Touch, which is the mood of passion.

original: shel zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi dbyibs dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan rnams bstan to //
analyzed: shel zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi dbyibs dang sku mdog dang phyag mtshan rnams bstan to //
translated: The line crystal and so forth teaches the shape, color, and hand implements of Vairochana.

original: gser gyi mdog can la zhes pa ni rgyas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gser gyi mdog can la zhes pa ni rgyas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The line the color of gold means that he is the nature of increase.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprin gyis kun du 'khrigs par bsgom pa'o zhes pa ni dbus kyi gtso bo nyid du bzhugs nas 'gro ba dbul ba'i sdug bsngal bcom pa'i phyir rang dang rjes su mthun pa dzambha la la sogs pa spro bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprin gyis kun du 'khrigs par bsgom pa'o zhes pa ni dbus kyi gtso bo nyid du bzhugs nas 'gro ba dbul ba'i sdug bsngal bcom pa'i phyir rang dang rjes su mthun pa dzambha la la sogs pa spro bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the cloud of Tathagatas is the central principal himself, who, in order to destroy the poverty of beings, emanates the appropriate Jambhala and so forth.

original: rdo rje rtse dgu pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse dgu pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nine-pointed vajra is the nature of the five Tathagatas and the four goddesses.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: And in the explanatory tantra it is said:

original: dbus rtse rnam par snang mdzad dang // shar la mi bskyod rin chen lhor //
analyzed: dbus rtse rnam par snang mdzad dang // shar la mi bskyod rin chen lhor //
translated: In the center is Vairocana, in the east is Akshobhya, in the south is Ratnasambhava,

original: nub dang byang gi rtse dag la //
analyzed: nub dang byang gi rtse dag la //
translated: in the west and north are the tips,

original: 'od dpag med dang don yod grub //
analyzed: 'od dpag med dang don yod grub //

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa ni //üîΩde yi 'dab ma re re la ;üîΩ/ shin du gsal ba'i phyag mtshan can //
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa ni // de yi 'dab ma re re la ; / shin du gsal ba'i phyag mtshan can //

original: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad yin te //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brgyad yin te //
translated: are the eight Bodhisattvas,üîΩeach with a very clear hand implement.

original: lag na padma byams pa dang // nam mkha'i snying po kun du bzang //
analyzed: lag na padma byams pa dang // nam mkha'i snying po kun du bzang //
translated: Maitreya with a lotus in his hand,üîΩAkashgarbha, and Samantabhadra,

original: gnod sbyin bdag po 'jam dpal dang // rnam par sel dang sa snying po //üîΩ'og tu shar rtser rdor mkha' 'gro //
analyzed: gnod sbyin bdag po 'jam dpal dang // rnam par sel dang sa snying po // 'og tu shar rtser rdor mkha' 'gro //
translated: The lord of the yakshas, Manjusri, and Vinayaka, and Kshitigarbha,üîΩare in the east and south, and in the west and north.

original: lhor 'jigs ma yi mkha' 'gro ma //üîΩnub tu gtum mo zhes ni bya //
analyzed: lhor 'jigs ma yi mkha' 'gro ma // nub tu gtum mo zhes ni bya //
translated: The dakini of the east is Vajra,üîΩthe dakini of the south is Bhima,üîΩthe dakini of the west is called Chandika,

original: ro langs ma ni byang du dgod //
analyzed: ro langs ma ni byang du dgod //
translated: and the dakini of the north is Vetali.

original: dbus su ye shes mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: dbus su ye shes mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: In the center is the dakini of wisdom.

original: 'og rtse rnam par dag pa yin //
analyzed: 'og rtse rnam par dag pa yin //
translated: The dakini of the zenith is pure.

original: spyan ma dang ni m'a ma k'i //
analyzed: spyan ma dang ni m'a ma k'i //
translated: Lochani, Mamaki,üîΩPANDARAVASINI, and Tara,

original: gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma dang // skul byed ma dang rin chen sgron //
analyzed: gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma dang // skul byed ma dang rin chen sgron //
translated: CHANDALI, Ratnanka,

original: ske rags gzhan gyis mi thub ma//
analyzed: ske rags gzhan gyis mi thub ma//
translated: the Mekhala, Aparajita,

original: padma la gnas mkha' 'gro ma //
analyzed: padma la gnas mkha' 'gro ma //
translated: and the dakini who dwells in the lotus,

original: rdo rje de nyid 'di yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid 'di yin no //
translated: are the vajra nature of reality.

original: dbus kyi chang zung ye shes dbyig / spro dang bsdu ba mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi chang zung ye shes dbyig / spro dang bsdu ba mdzad pa'o //
translated: The wisdom jewel in the center of the two pitchers

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is the one who emanates and gathers.

original: de ltar lha nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi rang bzhin ni rdo rje yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lha nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi rang bzhin ni rdo rje yin no //
translated: Thus, the nature of the twenty-eight deities is the vajra.

original: margata zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ltar sngo ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: margata zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ltar sngo ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Emerald means the color of the sky.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag mtshan gsungs pa'o zhes pa ni zur drug pa'i rin po che ste 'gro ba rigs drug pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi zur re res bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag mtshan gsungs pa'o zhes pa ni zur drug pa'i rin po che ste 'gro ba rigs drug pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi zur re res bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe symbol of Ratnasa·πÉbhava‚Äù refers to the jewel with six facets, because each facet of the jewel of the six kinds of living beings fulfills all their wishes.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i phyag mtshan gsungs pa'o zhes pa ni kha byed pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i padma r'a ga'i kha dog dang 'dra ba'i @169a * //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i phyag mtshan gsungs pa'o zhes pa ni kha byed pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i padma r'a ga'i kha dog dang 'dra ba'i @169a * //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe symbol of AmitƒÅbha‚Äù refers to the lotus, which is like the color of a ruby, and is endowed with the seal of the female consort.

original: padma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: padma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the word ‚Äúlotus.‚ÄùüîΩAs it is said:

original: ji ltar padma dmar po 'di //
analyzed: ji ltar padma dmar po 'di //
translated: Just as this red lotus

original: 'dam gyi skyon gyis ma gos pa //üîΩdngos po'i skyon ni sna tshogs pas //
analyzed: 'dam gyi skyon gyis ma gos pa // dngos po'i skyon ni sna tshogs pas //
translated: Is not soiled by the faults of the mud,

original: de bzhin khams gsum pa ni dag / ces 'byung ngo //üîΩsna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don sgrub par mdzad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas zhes pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin khams gsum pa ni dag / ces 'byung ngo // sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don sgrub par mdzad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas zhes pa la /
translated: So the one of the three realms is pureüîΩFrom the various faults of things.

original: don yod pa ni bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yod pa ni bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe nature of accomplishing the aims of all living beings in every way‚Äù means that Amoghasiddhi is the nature of the gnosis of successful activities.

original: 'od zer dkar po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa de ni don yod grub pa las thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od zer dkar po la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa de ni don yod grub pa las thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with white light, etc.

original: ral gri bsnams pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod par byed pa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo 'chang bas so//
analyzed: ral gri bsnams pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod par byed pa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo 'chang bas so//
translated: It holds a sword, because it holds the essence of the wisdom which cuts off all the afflictions.

original: des ni sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ye shes nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi khyad par gyi rnam pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ye shes nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi khyad par gyi rnam pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, in order to discipline sentient beings, it is taught that wisdom itself is the form of the various colors such as blue.

original: aindra bh'u ti'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang //
analyzed: aindra bh'u ti'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang //
translated: And Indrabhuti says:

original: shin tu rnam dag ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because of its nature of complete purity,

original: kha dog dkar pos rab tu bstan //
analyzed: kha dog dkar pos rab tu bstan //
translated: it is taught as the color white.

original: kun la gtong bas ser po nyid //
analyzed: kun la gtong bas ser po nyid //
translated: Because of its universal abandonment, it is yellow.

original: rtag tu brtse bas dmar po yin //
analyzed: rtag tu brtse bas dmar po yin //
translated: Because of its constant compassion, it is red.üîΩBecause of its striving to discipline

original: dkon mchog gsum la gnod byed sogs //üîΩ'dul bar byed pa la brtson pa //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la gnod byed sogs // 'dul bar byed pa la brtson pa //
translated: those who harm the Three Jewels, etc.,

original: 'gro ba'i don la mdzad pa'i mchog / ye shes de ni nag por bshad //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la mdzad pa'i mchog / ye shes de ni nag por bshad //
translated: that wisdom is said to be black.

original: sna tshogs thabs kyis gdul ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sna tshogs thabs kyis gdul ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of its various methods of discipline,üîΩit is taught to be the color of crystal.

original: kha dog ljang gu rab bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ljang gu rab bstan pa'o //
translated: The color is shown to be green.üîΩ

original: zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The color green is taught.

original: / de bzhin du thugs rdo rje 'chang ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa phyag mtshan gang yin pa de rnams ye shes kyi khyad par nyid yin no //
analyzed: / de bzhin du thugs rdo rje 'chang ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje la sogs pa phyag mtshan gang yin pa de rnams ye shes kyi khyad par nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the hand implements such as the vajra held by Vajradhara and so on are the distinctive features of the gnoses.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs la sogs pa skye mched rnams //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa skye mched rnams //
translated: The sense bases of form and so onüîΩare taught to be the six mudras

original: gang phyir rang nyid kyis brjod pa //
analyzed: gang phyir rang nyid kyis brjod pa //
translated: because they are expressed by their own names.

original: des na sangs rgyas ye shes ni //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas ye shes ni //
translated: Therefore, the gnosis of the buddhas

original: de bzhin gshegs pas phyag drug gsungs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas phyag drug gsungs //
translated: is said to be the six mudras by the Tathagata.

analyzed: drug bshad bzhi dang gsum gcig dang // ngo bo nyid med rang bzhin can //

translated: Those three syllables, by the process of entry, etc., move the winds twenty-one thousand and six hundred times in a day and night.

analyzed: de nyid yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pas ngag rnam par dag pa byed de //

analyzed: de nyid cha shas su thim pas ma ning gi bzlas pa'i mthar 'od gsal ba nyid thob par byed do //

analyzed: de nyid khro bo'i bzlas pa'i dus su bzlas par gyur pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las byed par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs bskul ba'i sgo nas de rnams kyi nus pa 'gugs par byed do//

original: de nyid thabs dang shes rab kyi snyoms par zhugs pas thur du rgyu ba can khu ba dang khrag dang chu'i ngo bo nyid rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang mi bskyod pa'i gzugs su rjes su 'jug go //

translated: By that very [wind], entering downward in union with method and praj√±a, it enters in the form of Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Akshobya, with the nature of semen, blood, and water.

analyzed: de nyid chos 'byung ba'i nang du spros pas bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa'i tshul du khams gsum pa dang de'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang skyed par byed do //
translated: It is generated in the womb of the source of phenomena, and by its proliferation, the ma·πá·∏çala-wheels, the nature of the three realms and their pure aspects, are generated in the manner of sons, grandsons, and so forth.

original: mtha' mar 'od gsal ba la zhugs nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed do //
analyzed: mtha' mar 'od gsal ba la zhugs nas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed do //
translated: In the end, having entered into clear light, one attains the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: de'i phyir khams gsum khyab par byed pa la longs spyod dang grol ba'i 'bras bu ster ba rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa gsum gyi bdag nyid yi ge gsum po kho na sngags thams cad kyi tshul du grags pas tshogs zhes bshad doüîΩ// de bas na sngags pa tu ba la sogs pa @173a * //

translated: Therefore, the three syllables, which are the nature of the three tathƒÅgatas, Vairocana, and so forth, who bestow the results of enjoyment and liberation in the pervasion of the three realms, are renowned as the method of all mantras.

original: bzhi po gong du bshad pa gang yin pa de dag yi ge gsum po kho na la brten te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhi po gong du bshad pa gang yin pa de dag yi ge gsum po kho na la brten te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the four, such as the mantra, which were explained above, are based on the three syllables alone, as taught by the BhagavƒÅn.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: brjod dang dmigs par grags pa dang // brdar gyur dang ni don dam mo //
analyzed: brjod dang dmigs par grags pa dang // brdar gyur dang ni don dam mo //
translated: The conventional, the symbolic, the nominal, the expressed, the object, the renowned, the conventional, the symbolic, and the ultimate.

original: tshig gi brjod pa thun mong ste //
analyzed: tshig gi brjod pa thun mong ste //

original: dmigs par bcas pa sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: dmigs par bcas pa sangs rgyas nyid //

analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid brda ru bshad //

original: don dam de bzhin nyid yin no //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: don dam de bzhin nyid yin no // zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad par bya ba'i phyir a'a li k'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to explain the reason, he says, ‚ÄúThe ƒÄlikƒÅli, etc.,‚Äù

original: aa la sogs pa'i phreng ba ni a'a li'o //

translated: The ƒÄlikƒÅli is the garland of the a, etc.

translated: The root of those which are the nature of the sixteen vowels a, etc., parts of the moon is the letter a itself.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: yi ge dam pa phra ba ni // aa yig gsal ba'i gtso bor gnas //
translated: the supreme letter, subtle,

analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: resides in the clear a.

analyzed: dbyangs yig gi phreng ba de nyid thabs dang shes rab nyis 'gyur du byas te mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That very garland of vowels, made into a double of method and wisdom, becomes the nature of the thirty-two excellent marks.

translated: That very [garland] with the visarga, the following vowels, the root of the tongue, the bumblebee, the following vowels, and the three final letters, with the thirty-three ornaments, becomes the nature of the eighty minor marks.

original: de nyid thung du lnga'i bdag nyid kyis phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid ye shes lnga'i mtshan nyid can thabs kyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //

translated: That very [garland] with the nature of the five short [vowels] becomes the nature of the five aggregates, characterized by the five gnoses, the nature of method, and the nature of the five tathagatas.

original: de nyid ring po lnga dang 'brel pa'i yi ge bzhi'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi sangs rgyas spyan ma la sogs pa'i yum bzhi dang gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa mchod pa'i lha mo lngar shes par bya'o //

translated: One should know that those very [vowels] are the four mothers such as BuddhalocanƒÅ, who are the nature of wisdom, and the five offering goddesses such as R≈´pavajrƒÅ, in the manner of the four syllables connected with the five long [vowels].

analyzed: ma ning gi yi ge bzhi yongs su spangs nas dbyangs bcu gnyis kyi tshul du phyi dang nang gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having completely abandoned the four neuter syllables, [the vowels] become the nature of the inner and outer sense bases in the manner of the twelve vowels.

translated: The four syllables connected in the manner of the long and short [vowels] together with LocanƒÅ and so forth are the nature of the ma·πá·∏çala wheel, which has thirteen aspects: the five Ones-Gone-Thus such as LocanƒÅ and the four wrathful ones such as Yamantaka.

original: de nyid ka la sogs pa'i yi ge lnga lnga @173b pa'i sde tshan lnga'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor lnga mthar gnas pa dang drod kyi yi ge dang tsheg drag dang rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dang
analyzed: de nyid ka la sogs pa'i yi ge lnga lnga @173b pa'i sde tshan lnga'i rang bzhin gyi lha mo bzhis yongs su bskor ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dkyil 'khor lnga mthar gnas pa dang drod kyi yi ge dang tsheg drag dang rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dang
translated: That is the five mandalas of the five transcendent ones surrounded by the four goddesses of the nature of the five groups of five letters beginning with ka, together with the final letters, the letters of heat, the visarga, and the vowels of the following,

original: lhan cig tu khro bo'i rgyal po bcus bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig tu khro bo'i rgyal po bcus bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and surrounded by the ten kings of wrath.

original: de ni thung ba dang ring ba dang 'phar ba'i dbye bas rnam pa bco brgyad kyi tshul gyis khams bco brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni thung ba dang ring ba dang 'phar ba'i dbye bas rnam pa bco brgyad kyi tshul gyis khams bco brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That is the wheel of the mandala, which has the nature of the eighteen elements by way of the eighteen types of short, long, and high vowels.

original: de la thung ba dang ring ba dang 'phar ba ste re re la rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dang bcas pa dang rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs med pa dang mtho ba dang dma' ba dang bar ma'o //
analyzed: de la thung ba dang ring ba dang 'phar ba ste re re la rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs dang bcas pa dang rjes su 'jug pa'i dbyangs med pa dang mtho ba dang dma' ba dang bar ma'o //
translated: There, short, long, and high vowels each have the nature of the following vowels, with and without, and high, low, and middle.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: thung dang ring dang 'phar ma dang // dbyangs ni gsum po dang sbyar dang // sna rjes 'gro ba'i med pa yis //
analyzed: thung dang ring dang 'phar ma dang // dbyangs ni gsum po dang sbyar dang // sna rjes 'gro ba'i med pa yis //
translated: the nasal,

original: grangs su rnam pa bco brgyad yin //
analyzed: grangs su rnam pa bco brgyad yin //
translated: are the eighteen varieties.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i yi ge aa'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i phreng ba ni a'a li zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i yi ge aa'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i phreng ba ni a'a li zhes bya'o //
translated: The garland endowed with the connection of the letter A is called the A-li.

original: de bzhin du ka'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i phreng ba ni k'a li zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ka'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i phreng ba ni k'a li zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the garland endowed with the connection of the letter Ka is called the Ka-li.

original: a'a li dang k'a li de dag yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i yi ge ni phyi mo'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: a'a li dang k'a li de dag yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i yi ge ni phyi mo'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Those A-lis and Ka-lis are the forty-nine letters, which are of the nature of the outer.üîΩThe letters of the nature of the neuter, etc.

original: ma ning la sogs pa'i gzugs can rnams ni zhes pa ni de la bud med kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge aa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma ning la sogs pa'i gzugs can rnams ni zhes pa ni de la bud med kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge aa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Among them, the nature of the female is the letters A, etc.

original: shes rab kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are of the nature of wisdom.

original: pho rtags kyi rang bzhin ni ka la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pho rtags kyi rang bzhin ni ka la sogs pa ste /

original: thabs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are of the nature of method.

original: gnyis ka dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i rang bzhin ya la sogs pa ste ma ning gi rtags kyi ngo bor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i rang bzhin ya la sogs pa ste ma ning gi rtags kyi ngo bor shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the nature of the letters ya and so on, which are the letters of the neuter gender, is the nature of both.

original: yi ge gsum du zhugs pas mo rtags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi aa la sogs pa de rnams sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid kyi yi ge gsum la bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge gsum du zhugs pas mo rtags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi aa la sogs pa de rnams sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid kyi yi ge gsum la bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are included in the three syllables, the letters a and so on, which are the nature of the female gender and so on, are included in the three syllables that are the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: da ni 'di ltar dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di ltar dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now, this should be analyzed.

original: mo rtags dang pho rtags dang ma ning gi rtags ni ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: mo rtags dang pho rtags dang ma ning gi rtags ni ji lta bu yin zhe na /

original: de la kha cig na re /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re /

original: nu ma skra can bud med yin /
analyzed: nu ma skra can bud med yin /
translated: One with breasts and hair is female.

original: kha spu dang ldan skyes par bshad //
analyzed: kha spu dang ldan skyes par bshad //
translated: One with a beard is said to be male.

original: gang zhig gnyis ka las 'das pa'i //üîΩde ni ma ning bshad pa yin ;
analyzed: gang zhig gnyis ka las 'das pa'i // de ni ma ning bshad pa yin ;
translated: One who is beyond both

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: is said to be neuter.

original: de yang mi rigs te /üîΩgal te nu ma dang skra can mo rtags yin na /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te / gal te nu ma dang skra can mo rtags yin na /
translated: That is not reasonable.üîΩIf having breasts and hair are the characteristics of the female gender,

original: de'i tshe phreng ba dang nyal khri la sogs pa dag mo rtags su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe phreng ba dang nyal khri la sogs pa dag mo rtags su mi 'gyur te /
translated: then garlands, beds, and so on would not be the female gender.

original: de rnams nu ma dang skar mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams nu ma dang skar mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have breasts or a penis.

original: 'breg pa'i skra dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs dag kyang mo rtags su 'gyur ro //üîΩsbyar ba'i nu ma @174a * //
analyzed: 'breg pa'i skra dang ldan pa'i sa phyogs dag kyang mo rtags su 'gyur ro // sbyar ba'i nu ma @174a * //
translated: And a place where hair is shaved would be a female sign.

original: dang skra'i cha lugs 'dzin pa'i gar mkhan skyes pa yang mo rtags nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin du /
analyzed: dang skra'i cha lugs 'dzin pa'i gar mkhan skyes pa yang mo rtags nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro // de bzhin du /
translated: A dancer who puts on the appearance of breasts and hair would be a female.

original: kha spu dang ldan pa pho rtags yin na sgog pa la sogs pa yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha spu dang ldan pa pho rtags yin na sgog pa la sogs pa yang de nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
