original: de rnams ni sgra'i gzugs la ltos pas ma ning gi rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni sgra'i gzugs la ltos pas ma ning gi rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are neuter signs in dependence on the form of the word.

original: gnas la sogs pa gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kha spu dang ldan pas pho rtags su 'gyur ba dang / skyes pa kha cig kha spu dang mi ldan pas mo rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kha spu dang ldan pas pho rtags su 'gyur ba dang / skyes pa kha cig kha spu dang mi ldan pas mo rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And yoginis who live in places such as cremation grounds would be male signs because they have beards, and some men would be female signs because they do not have beards.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That also is not tenable.

original: gnyis ka'i rang bzhin gyi rtags ma ning yin nas la sogs pa rnams kyang ma ning nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rang bzhin gyi rtags ma ning yin nas la sogs pa rnams kyang ma ning nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the neuter sign, which is the nature of both, would also be neuter.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not tenable,

original: de rnams mo rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams mo rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those are the characteristics of the female sign.

original: gzhan na re 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang / bar ma ni pho rtags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan na re 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang / bar ma ni pho rtags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Another says: Increase, decrease, and the middle are the characteristics of the male sign and so on.

original: de la 'phel ba ni nus pa dang po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phel ba ni nus pa dang po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In that regard, increase is possessing the first ability.

original: 'grib pa ni nus pa chung ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'grib pa ni nus pa chung ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Decrease is possessing a small ability.

original: bar ma ni nus pa bar ma dang ldan pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: bar ma ni nus pa bar ma dang ldan pa'o zhe na /
translated: The middle is possessing a middle ability.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so,

original: gang gi phyir gal te 'grib pa ni mo rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe bu mo skye na de'i tshe nus pa 'phel bas pho rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te 'grib pa ni mo rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe bu mo skye na de'i tshe nus pa 'phel bas pho rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because if decrease is the characteristic of the female sign, then when a daughter is born, since her ability increases, it follows that she would have the male sign.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That is also untenable,üîΩbecause

original: de bzhin du 'phel ba zhes bya ba pho rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe skyes bu rgas pas de'i nus pa 'grib par 'gyur na mo rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phel ba zhes bya ba pho rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe skyes bu rgas pas de'i nus pa 'grib par 'gyur na mo rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if the male sex is defined as the capacity for growth, then when the capacity for growth of an old man diminishes, it follows that he would become a woman.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: This is unacceptable.

original: skyes pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he would not have lost his masculinity.

original: nus pa bar ma ma ning gi rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe skyes pa'am bud med nus pa bar ma dang ldan pas ma ning nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa bar ma ma ning gi rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe skyes pa'am bud med nus pa bar ma dang ldan pas ma ning nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the neuter sex is defined as the capacity for neither, then it follows that either a man or a woman who has the capacity for neither would be neuter.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid de dag ni ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid de dag ni ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these definitions are not certain.

original: kha cig na re skad rags pa la sogs pa pho rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin la //
analyzed: kha cig na re skad rags pa la sogs pa pho rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin la //
translated: Some say: The male sex is defined as a coarse voice, etc.

original: skad phra ba la sogs pa ni mo rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: skad phra ba la sogs pa ni mo rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The female sex is defined as a fine voice, etc.

original: de dag med na ni ma ning gi mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag med na ni ma ning gi mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: The neuter sex is defined as the absence of both.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gal te skad rags pa la sogs pa pho rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te skad rags pa la sogs pa pho rtags kyi mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: because if the male sex is defined as a coarse voice, etc.,

original: de'i tshe mdzes zin pa'i skyes pa rnams skad phra ba yin pas mo rtags su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / dbyangs rags pa'i mo rnams kyang pho rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mdzes zin pa'i skyes pa rnams skad phra ba yin pas mo rtags su thal bar 'gyur ba dang / dbyangs rags pa'i mo rnams kyang pho rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it would follow that men who have a soft voice would be women, and women who have a deep voice would be men.

original: gnyis ka med pa ma ning yin na phreng ba dang nyal @174b khri la sogs pa ma ning du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka med pa ma ning yin na phreng ba dang nyal @174b khri la sogs pa ma ning du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the neuter is that which is neither, it would follow that rosaries, beds, etc. would be neuter, because they are neither.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That is unacceptable.

original: de rnams mo rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams mo rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the characteristics of women.

original: skad rags pa dang ldan pa'i rdza rnga la sogs pa yang pho rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad rags pa dang ldan pa'i rdza rnga la sogs pa yang pho rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that drums, etc. which have a deep sound would be men.

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: That is unacceptable.

original: ma ning yin pas so //
analyzed: ma ning yin pas so //
translated: Because they are neuter.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid de yang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid de yang ma nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that definition is also indefinite.

original: bu chung chags pa la sogs pa yang mo rtags kyi mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: bu chung chags pa la sogs pa yang mo rtags kyi mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: It is also unreasonable for the characteristics of a woman to be the development of breasts, etc.

original: mo bsham la de med pas skyes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mo bsham la de med pas skyes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that a woman who is castrated would be a man.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa pho rtags kyi mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa pho rtags kyi mtshan nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the characteristics of a male are endowed with wisdom,

original: de dang ldan pa'i mo rnams kyang skyes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i mo rnams kyang skyes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that those endowed with that are males.

original: chags pa'i cha che ba dang chung bas mo rtags dang pho rtags yin na de'i chags pa che ba'i skyes pa yang mo rtags nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / chags pa chung ba'i bud med kyang skyes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags pa'i cha che ba dang chung bas mo rtags dang pho rtags yin na de'i chags pa che ba'i skyes pa yang mo rtags nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / chags pa chung ba'i bud med kyang skyes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the male and female characteristics are due to a predominance of passion or a lack of passion, then it would follow that a male with a predominance of passion would have the female characteristics, and a female with a lack of passion would have the male characteristics.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid de yang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid de yang ma nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, those characteristics are also indeterminate.

original: pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa yang pho rtags dang mo rtags kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa yang pho rtags dang mo rtags kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te //
translated: One who possesses the male faculty and the female faculty does not have the characteristics of a male or a female,

original: nang du chud pas pho'i dbang po mi mngon pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mo rtags su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang du chud pas pho'i dbang po mi mngon pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams mo rtags su thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, who have internalized the male faculty and do not manifest it, would have the female characteristics.

original: mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa yang mo rtags ma yin te /
analyzed: mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa yang mo rtags ma yin te /
translated: One who possesses the female faculty does not have the female characteristics,üîΩbecause it would follow that the female who has entered the state of non-discrimination would have the male characteristics.

original: ma ning la de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ning la de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the neuter has that.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid de yang ma nges so //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid de yang ma nges so //
translated: Therefore, that definition is also indefinite.

original: rtags ni khyad par med pa ste //
analyzed: rtags ni khyad par med pa ste //
translated: The sign is not distinguished,üîΩbecause it is based on the world.

original: 'jig rten la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar brda sprod pa rnams kyis smra ba de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar brda sprod pa rnams kyis smra ba de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because the grammarians say this.

original: gal te 'jig rten la brten pa'i rtags yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten la brten pa'i rtags yin na /
translated: If the sign is based on the world,

original: de'i tshe dngos po thams cad ni rtags thams can dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po thams cad ni rtags thams can dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that all things have all signs,

original: 'gram dang khang pa la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gram dang khang pa la sogs pa'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the words ‚Äúbank,‚Äù ‚Äúhouse,‚Äù and so on.

original: de bas na pho rtags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rigs pas grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na pho rtags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rigs pas grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the definition of male and so on is not established by reasoning.

original: 'dir smras pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa dang gnyis ka dang bral ba ni pho rtags dang mo rtags dang ma ning gi rtags yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa dang gnyis ka dang bral ba ni pho rtags dang mo rtags dang ma ning gi rtags yin te /
translated: Here someone might say, ‚ÄúThe neuter is free from both the sign of the pervader and the sign of the pervaded.

original: gang gi phyir snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba chen pos gang gis khyab par byed pa ni sems kyi rgyud de'i rang bzhin du byed pa khyab par byed pa de ni mo rtags yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba chen pos gang gis khyab par byed pa ni sems kyi rgyud de'i rang bzhin du byed pa khyab par byed pa de ni mo rtags yin no //
translated: Because at the time of entering into meditative concentration, the continuum of mind is pervaded by the great bliss of innate joy, and that which pervades is the nature of that continuum of mind, it is the female gender.

original: bde ba chen pos khyab par bya ba ni pho rtags yin no //
analyzed: bde ba chen pos khyab par bya ba ni pho rtags yin no //
translated: That which is pervaded by great bliss is the male gender.

original: bde ba chen pos khyab pa dang khyab par byed pa med pas @175a * //
analyzed: bde ba chen pos khyab pa dang khyab par byed pa med pas @175a * //
translated: Since there is neither that which is pervaded nor that which pervades with great bliss,

original: gnyis ka dang bral ba ni ma ning gi rtags yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ka dang bral ba ni ma ning gi rtags yin te /
translated: the absence of both is the neuter gender.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The world of the environment.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dngos po rnams la mo rtags la sogs pa gang yod pa de ni brtags pa ba yin te /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dngos po rnams la mo rtags la sogs pa gang yod pa de ni brtags pa ba yin te /
translated: Whatever female gender, etc., exists in the entities of the world of the environment is imputed,

original: don dam par de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately it does not exist.

original: de bzhin du dbyangs kyi sde tshan zla ba'i cha bcu drug gi rang bzhin gyis gsal bya'i sde tshan khyab par byed pas ni tshim par byed pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin ni a'a li ste mo rtags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyangs kyi sde tshan zla ba'i cha bcu drug gi rang bzhin gyis gsal bya'i sde tshan khyab par byed pas ni tshim par byed pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin ni a'a li ste mo rtags so //
translated: Likewise, the class of vowels, which has the nature of the sixteen parts of the moon, pervades the class of consonants, which is to be illuminated. The class of consonants, which is the nature of wisdom, is ƒÅli, the female sign.

original: khyab par bya ba ni de rnams kyis brjod par bya ba de ni k'a li ste thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi pho rtags yin no //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba ni de rnams kyis brjod par bya ba de ni k'a li ste thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi pho rtags yin no //
translated: The pervaded is that which is to be expressed by those [vowels and consonants]. That is the class of consonants, which is the nature of method, the male sign.

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa gnyis ka'i rang bzhin ni ya la sogs pa'i sde tshan te ma ning gi rtags so //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa gnyis ka'i rang bzhin ni ya la sogs pa'i sde tshan te ma ning gi rtags so //
translated: The nature of both the pervaded and the pervader is the class beginning with ya, the neuter sign.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mo rtags kyi rang bzhin dbyangs kyi sde tshan gyi thog ma dang tha ma'i yi ge gnyis yang dag par sbyar nas shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi yi ge aa ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mo rtags kyi rang bzhin dbyangs kyi sde tshan gyi thog ma dang tha ma'i yi ge gnyis yang dag par sbyar nas shes rab kyi rang bzhin gyi yi ge aa ru 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, the first and last letters of the class of vowels, which have the nature of the female sign, are combined and become the letter a, which has the nature of wisdom.

original: yi ge ka la sogs pa yang dag par sbyor bas thabs kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge h'um ste pho rtags yin no //
analyzed: yi ge ka la sogs pa yang dag par sbyor bas thabs kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge h'um ste pho rtags yin no //
translated: By combining the letters ka and so on, which have the nature of method, the letter h≈´·πÉ arises, which is the male sign.

original: ya la sogs pa sde tshan yongs su gyur pa las yi ge aom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ya la sogs pa sde tshan yongs su gyur pa las yi ge aom du 'gyur ro //
translated: The complete transformation of ya and so forth is the syllable o·πÉ.

original: de la aa au ma zhes yang dag par sbyor bas aom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la aa au ma zhes yang dag par sbyor bas aom du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the correct application of a and u, it becomes o·πÉ.

original: yi ge aa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yi ge aa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The syllable a is the nature of wisdom.

original: yi ge ma ni thabs kyi rang bzhin te //
analyzed: yi ge ma ni thabs kyi rang bzhin te //
translated: The syllable ma is the nature of method.

original: gsal bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of illumination.

original: yi ge aom ni de dang sbyor ba'i rang bzhin te ma ning zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge aom ni de dang sbyor ba'i rang bzhin te ma ning zhes bya'o //
translated: The syllable o·πÉ is the nature of the union of those two, called the neuter.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang thabs gnyis ka yang dag par sbyor ba'i rang bzhin gyi ma ning gi rtags so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang thabs gnyis ka yang dag par sbyor ba'i rang bzhin gyi ma ning gi rtags so //
translated: For that very reason, the neuter is the sign of the nature of the correct union of both wisdom and method.

original: de ltar pho rtags dang mo rtags gnyis ka'i rang bzhin ni aom la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum yin no //
analyzed: de ltar pho rtags dang mo rtags gnyis ka'i rang bzhin ni aom la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, the three syllables o·πÉ and so forth are the nature of both the male and female signs.

original: mnyam par gzhag cing zhes pa ni skad kyi byings don du ma yin pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sgra ni bzlas pa'i don la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag cing zhes pa ni skad kyi byings don du ma yin pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa'i sgra ni bzlas pa'i don la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúequipoised‚Äù is a verbal root with many meanings. Therefore, the term ‚Äúequipoise‚Äù is used in the sense of recitation.

original: de nyin dang mtshan du ldang ba dang 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang zhes pa ni srog gi rlung nang du zhugs pa ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de nyin dang mtshan du ldang ba dang 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang zhes pa ni srog gi rlung nang du zhugs pa ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: The arising, entering, and abiding are the life-force wind entering inside, which is entering.

original: me dang mnyam pa'i rlung bar du gzhag pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: me dang mnyam pa'i rlung bar du gzhag pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The abiding is the fire-coinciding wind abiding in the middle.

original: srog gi rlung gyen du rgyu ba ni ldang ba yin no //
analyzed: srog gi rlung gyen du rgyu ba ni ldang ba yin no //
translated: The arising is the life-force wind moving upward.

original: de bas na rlung gi bya ba de dag gsum ni 'gugs pa dang / bzhugs su gsol ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rlung gi bya ba de dag gsum ni 'gugs pa dang / bzhugs su gsol ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those three actions of the wind should be understood to be the nature of the summoning, the supplicating to remain, and the supplicating to depart.

original: gang gi phyir yi ge aom brjod pa'i @175b dus su nang gi tshul du rlung 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yi ge aom brjod pa'i @175b dus su nang gi tshul du rlung 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because when the letter o·πÉ is uttered, the wind enters internally.

original: yi ge h'um brjod pa'i dus su phyi'i tshul du rlung 'byung bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um brjod pa'i dus su phyi'i tshul du rlung 'byung bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: When the letter h≈´·πÉ is uttered, the wind is indicated as going outside.

original: yi ge aa brjod pa'i dus su rlung ni bar na gnas pa mtshon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge aa brjod pa'i dus su rlung ni bar na gnas pa mtshon par 'gyur te /
translated: When the letter a is uttered, the wind is indicated as abiding in the middle.

original: rlung dang yi ge tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung dang yi ge tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the wind and the letters are not different.

original: de la rlung rgyu bas yi ge rnams 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la rlung rgyu bas yi ge rnams 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The letters arise from the movement of the wind.

original: yi ge brjod pa'i dus su rlung nyid kyis rtsol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge brjod pa'i dus su rlung nyid kyis rtsol bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of the utterance of the letters, the winds themselves are the effort.

original: de bas na bya ba dang byed pa'i 'brel ba'am phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i 'brel pas rlung dang yi ge dbyer med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bya ba dang byed pa'i 'brel ba'am phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i 'brel pas rlung dang yi ge dbyer med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the winds and the letters are inseparable, by the relation of action and agent, or by the relation of the one to be benefited and the one who benefits.

original: rlung gi las kyi bdag nyid kyi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ni rlung dang de'i bdag nyid du 'jug pas rlung las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rlung gi las kyi bdag nyid kyi 'jug pa la sogs pa'i bya ba ni rlung dang de'i bdag nyid du 'jug pas rlung las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The action of the winds, such as entering, is not different from the winds, because it enters as the nature of the winds.

original: 'gro ba dang bskum pa dang brkyang ba'i mtshan nyid de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang bskum pa dang brkyang ba'i mtshan nyid de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it has the characteristic of going, bending, and stretching.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: yi ge aom gyi dbugs ni nang du 'jug pa dang / yi ge aa'i sngags ni bar du gnas pa dang / yi ge h'um gyi sngags ni ldang bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge aom gyi dbugs ni nang du 'jug pa dang / yi ge aa'i sngags ni bar du gnas pa dang / yi ge h'um gyi sngags ni ldang bar gyur pa ste /
translated: The breath of the letter Om is the entering inside, the mantra of the letter A is the abiding in the middle, and the mantra of the letter Hum is the rising up.

original: rkan dang mchu dag 'brel med gsang sngags bzla //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rkan dang mchu dag 'brel med gsang sngags bzla //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Recite the mantra without contact of palate and lips.

original: der ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bar du gnas pa'i 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba de rnam pa gsum gyis bzlas pas na zhes pa ni yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pas rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu gcig pa'i
analyzed: der ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bar du gnas pa'i 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba de rnam pa gsum gyis bzlas pas na zhes pa ni yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pas rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bcu gcig pa'i
translated: There, the repetition of the three aspects of engagement and abiding and arising is the repetition of the undiminished branches.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa ting nge 'dzin gang gis byed pa de la de skad ces bshad do //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa ting nge 'dzin gang gis byed pa de la de skad ces bshad do //
translated: The meditative concentration of vajra repetition is explained as that by which the eleven aspects of Great Vajradhara and so on are accomplished.

original: yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa ni sngags dang rlung dang lha'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ye shes gsum dang khams gsum dang rtsa gsum dang de kho na nyid gsum dang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang sku gsung thugs dang sku gsum dang rdzas gsum
analyzed: yan lag ma nyams pa'i bzlas pa ni sngags dang rlung dang lha'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ye shes gsum dang khams gsum dang rtsa gsum dang de kho na nyid gsum dang rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang sku gsung thugs dang sku gsum dang rdzas gsum
translated: The repetition of the undiminished branches is the essence of the three pristine consciousnesses, the three realms, the three channels, the three realities, the three doors of liberation, the body, speech, and mind, the three bodies, and the three substances, which are the purity of mantra, wind, and deity.

original: dang srid pa gsum dang 'jig rten gsum la sogs pa gcig tu byas pa'i yid la byed pa'i mos pas rdo rje tshig gis sems rtse gcig pa thob pa'i bar du rdo rje bzlas pa bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dang srid pa gsum dang 'jig rten gsum la sogs pa gcig tu byas pa'i yid la byed pa'i mos pas rdo rje tshig gis sems rtse gcig pa thob pa'i bar du rdo rje bzlas pa bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The vajra repetition is the vajra recitation that is the one-pointed mind obtained by means of the conviction that takes as its object the single entity of the three vajras, the three existences, the three worlds, and so on.

original: phyi rol gyi bzlas pa brjod pa'am thos pa ngag gi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bzlas pa brjod pa'am thos pa ngag gi bzlas pa'i rang bzhin brtag par bya ba ma yin no //

analyzed: rkan dang mchu dang lce sogs kyi // gang zhig g-yo bar gyur pa ni // de nyid mi 'gyur ga las te //

original: 'gyur ba nyid du gnas pa'i phyir //

analyzed: de ltar bde gshegs drug po ni //

translated: The six, Vairochana and so on, are taught for the person who is like a jewel, who cultivates the stage of completion.

original: des na don 'di yin te /

analyzed: grangs 'di nyid kyis mdor na zla ba gcig gis 'bum phrag drug tu 'gyur ro //

original: ji skad du /

analyzed: sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham gyur zhes pa ni tshig gnyis kyis mi bskyod pa bstan to //

original: de nyid gsum du 'dir brtags pa'o zhes pa la sku gsung thugs kyi bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang chen po aa ham zhes cig car du nga rgyal bskyed la snga ma bzhin du /

analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: gcig gyur pa //

translated: ‚ÄúCorrect‚Äù means that which is to be attained by the direct perception of the yogi, or by the direct perception of self-awareness, which is a clear appearance, non-conceptual, and non-erroneous.

analyzed: lha mo bzhis yongs su zhus pa'i bshad pa'i rgyud las kyang //

analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa bshad nas /

analyzed: 'od kyi tshogs dang bcas pa sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba'i de kho na nyid bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: des ni sems la dmigs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the stages of observing the mind.

original: 'ja' tshon ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis ye shes kyi sku sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ja' tshon ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis ye shes kyi sku sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The rainbow body and so forth means that one should meditate on the wisdom body, which is indicated by the twelve examples of illusion, by the power of former aspirations.

original: dkar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lngas brgyan pa'o zhes pa ni dkar po la sogs pa'i sku mdog lngas nye bar mtshon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga las 'byung ba lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo'i rgyal po dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i 'od zer lngas brgyan pa'o zhes pa ni dkar po la sogs pa'i sku mdog lngas nye bar mtshon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rigs lnga las 'byung ba lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo'i rgyal po dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The ornamented with the five lights of white and so forth means that the five colors of white and so forth indicate the five Tathagatas of the five families, together with the goddesses, Bodhisattvas, and wrathful kings.

original: khams phra ba zhes pa la /
analyzed: khams phra ba zhes pa la /
translated: The subtle constituents means

original: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: the reality of clear light.

original: snang ba mched pa @177b la sogs pa'i rim pa 'am cig car gyi rnal 'byor gyis de las 'byung ba'i yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba mched pa @177b la sogs pa'i rim pa 'am cig car gyi rnal 'byor gyis de las 'byung ba'i yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection that arises from that means that by the yoga of the stages of appearance, increase, and so forth, or by the yoga of the instant, one should meditate on the perfection that arises from that.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes pa la brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes pa la brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: The nature of all things is the nature of the animate and inanimate,

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: or the nature of one's own and others' continua, illustrated by the twelve examples of illusion.üîΩThe five light rays of movement and so forth are the five branch winds called moving, fully moving, perfectly moving, well moving, and definitely moving.

original: rgyu ba la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga ste zhes pa la rgyu ba dang rnam par rgyu ba dang yang dag par rgyu ba dang / rab tu rgyu ba dang nges par rgyu ba dang zhes bya ba yan lag gi rlung lnga ste sgra ji bzhin ma yin pas rdo rje'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las /
analyzed: rgyu ba la sogs pa'i 'od zer lnga ste zhes pa la rgyu ba dang rnam par rgyu ba dang yang dag par rgyu ba dang / rab tu rgyu ba dang nges par rgyu ba dang zhes bya ba yan lag gi rlung lnga ste sgra ji bzhin ma yin pas rdo rje'i sgo zhes bya ba'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las /
translated: The Great Yoga Tantra called the Unraveling of the Intention says:üîΩSnake, tortoise, lizard,

original: sbrul dang rus sbal rtsangs pa dang // lha sbyin dang ni gzhu las rgyal//üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sbrul dang rus sbal rtsangs pa dang // lha sbyin dang ni gzhu las rgyal// zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Devadatta, and victory over the bow.

original: de rnams kyi 'od zer ni yul gzung bar bya ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams 'jug go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'od zer ni yul gzung bar bya ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams 'jug go //
translated: Their light rays enter the eyes and so forth in order to apprehend objects.

original: de dang ldan pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag dag gis yul dang dbang po'i nye bar spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag dag gis yul dang dbang po'i nye bar spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One who possesses that is said to possess the objects and faculties through the branches of withdrawal and meditative concentration.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩWhatever is seen and touched,

original: gang zhig mthong ba reg pa dang / thams cad sgyu ma bzhin mthong ste //
analyzed: gang zhig mthong ba reg pa dang / thams cad sgyu ma bzhin mthong ste //
translated: all is seen to be like an illusion.

original: kun rdzob tu ni mi gnas pas //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni mi gnas pas //
translated: Since it does not abide in the relative,

original: sgyu ma bzhin du mtshon par bya //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du mtshon par bya //
translated: it is illustrated as like an illusion.

original: dbang po gang dang gang lam gyis //
analyzed: dbang po gang dang gang lam gyis //
translated: By the path of whatever faculty,

original: de dang de yi rang bzhin 'gro //
analyzed: de dang de yi rang bzhin 'gro //
translated: one goes to its nature.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of non-equipoise,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin lha //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin lha //
translated: the nature of all buddhas is the deity.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang de bzhin dri //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang de bzhin dri //
translated: Form, sound, and likewise smell,

original: ro dang reg bya nyid dag la //
analyzed: ro dang reg bya nyid dag la //
translated: taste, and touch

original: mig la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni //
translated: the engagement of the eyes and so on

original: sgyu ma bzhin du mtshon par bya //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du mtshon par bya //
translated: is illustrated as like an illusion.

original: 'dir ni mang po smos ci dgos //
analyzed: 'dir ni mang po smos ci dgos //
translated: What need is there to say much here?

original: rdo rje theg par de nyid la //
analyzed: rdo rje theg par de nyid la //
translated: In the Vajra Vehicle,

original: gang yang rnal 'byor pas dmigs pa'i /
analyzed: gang yang rnal 'byor pas dmigs pa'i /
translated: whatever is observed by the yogi

original: de de sgyu ma bzhin gzhan min //
analyzed: de de sgyu ma bzhin gzhan min //
translated: is not other than that, like an illusion.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: So it is said.

original: yul rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa'i rim pas gzung ste /
analyzed: yul rnams la nye bar longs spyod pa zhes pa ni so sor sdud pa'i rim pas gzung ste /
translated: ‚Äú Enjoying the objects‚Äù is to be understood by the stage of the individual withdrawal.

original: bsam gtan gyi rim pas rnam par dag pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rim pas rnam par dag pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of purification by the stage of meditation.

original: dbang po lnga rnams so zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga rnams so zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Adorned with the five senses‚Äù is the eye, etc.

original: de rnams kyis brgyan pa zhes pa la sgyu ma lta bu'i dbang po dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de rnams kyis brgyan pa zhes pa la sgyu ma lta bu'i dbang po dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: ‚Äú Adorned with them‚Äù means possessing the senses which are like an illusion.

original: khrag dang sha la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khrag dang sha la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not of the nature of blood, flesh, etc.üîΩIn the Prakarana,

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang //
translated: it says,

original: khyod kyi sku la khong stong med //
analyzed: khyod kyi sku la khong stong med //
translated: Your body is not hollow,

original: sha dang rus pa khrag kyang med //üîΩnam mkha'i 'ja' tshon dang mtshungs pa'i //
analyzed: sha dang rus pa khrag kyang med // nam mkha'i 'ja' tshon dang mtshungs pa'i //
translated: it has no flesh, bones, or blood.üîΩYour body is shown to be

original: khyod kyi sku ni ston par byed //
analyzed: khyod kyi sku ni ston par byed //
translated: like a rainbow in the sky.

original: sku la snyun dang mi gtsang med //
analyzed: sku la snyun dang mi gtsang med //
translated: Your body has no illness or impurity,

original: bkres dang skom pa mi srid de //
analyzed: bkres dang skom pa mi srid de //
translated: and hunger and thirst are impossible.

original: khyod @178a * //
analyzed: khyod @178a * //
translated: You

original: kyis 'jig rten 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kyis 'jig rten 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to engage the world,

original: 'jig rten bya ba bstan par mdzad //
analyzed: 'jig rten bya ba bstan par mdzad //
translated: you show worldly activity.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: So it is said.

original: dbang po tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ji ltar dri za'i sems can gzugs dang dbang po phra ba dang ldan pa de bzhin du sgyu ma'i sku yang gzugs dang dbang po phra ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ji ltar dri za'i sems can gzugs dang dbang po phra ba dang ldan pa de bzhin du sgyu ma'i sku yang gzugs dang dbang po phra ba dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the gandharva sentient being has subtle form and faculties, so the illusory body is said to have subtle form and faculties.

original: dbang po tshang ba'i dri za ni //
analyzed: dbang po tshang ba'i dri za ni //
translated: The gandharva with complete faculties

original: de nyid dri za'i sems can te //
analyzed: de nyid dri za'i sems can te //
translated: is just that sentient being, the gandharva.

original: rdo rje'i sku yang de nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku yang de nyid do //
translated: The vajra body is just that.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i sku'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i sku'o //
translated: Such a form is the illusory body.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor gsal bar 'jug cing zhes pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor gsal bar 'jug cing zhes pa la /
translated: Clearly entering the mandala of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dkyil ni snying po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dkyil ni snying po'o //
translated: Buddha means the tathagatas. Mandala means the essence.

original: de len zhing 'dzin par byed pas na sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de len zhing 'dzin par byed pas na sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Because it takes and holds that, it is the mandala of the buddhas.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang de bzhin nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang chos nyid kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang de bzhin nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang chos nyid kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The reality limit, the reality limit of the perfection of wisdom, the reality limit of the perfection of giving, and so on, are synonyms for the clear light nature of reality.

original: de la 'jug cing zhes pa ni phyag rgya'i rim pa'am ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas yang dag pa'i mthar 'jug par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'jug cing zhes pa ni phyag rgya'i rim pa'am ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas yang dag pa'i mthar 'jug par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: To enter into that means to enter into the reality limit by the stage of the seal or by the stage of meditative concentration.

original: de ltar bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas bdag la byin gyis brlab pas mtshan nyid kyi sku rim pa bzhi pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas bdag la byin gyis brlab pas mtshan nyid kyi sku rim pa bzhi pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in that way, oneself and so on means that one should enter into clear light by the fourth stage, the characteristic body of consecration.

original: skad cig ma'i rnam par shes pa ni cig car du spro ba'o ;
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rnam par shes pa ni cig car du spro ba'o ;
translated: The momentary consciousness is the simultaneous emanation.

original: / rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku zhes pa la rdo rje sku'i rnam grangs can dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs so //
analyzed: / rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku zhes pa la rdo rje sku'i rnam grangs can dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs so //
translated: The body of Great Vajradhara is the form of the great seal of glorious Vajrasattva, which is a synonym for the vajra body.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi dbus su zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi dbus su zhes pa ni /
translated: In the middle of cyclic existence and nirvana means

original: srid pa dang zhi ba'i ro mnyam pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: srid pa dang zhi ba'i ro mnyam pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: It has the nature of the equality of existence and peace.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba zhes pa la /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba zhes pa la /
translated: It is free from the positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: This is just an illustration.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa dang rtag pa dang chad pa dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa dang brtags pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa dang sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku dang / thabs dang shes rab dang stong pa nyid dang snying rje la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa dang rtag pa dang chad pa dang kun rdzob dang don dam pa dang brtags pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa dang sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku dang / thabs dang shes rab dang stong pa nyid dang snying rje la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the concepts of existence and nonexistence, entity and nonentity, eternalism and nihilism, relative and ultimate, imagined and perfect, mantra body and gnosis body, method and wisdom, emptiness and compassion, and so on.

original: bdag nyid ces pa ni rang gi sku'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces pa ni rang gi sku'o //
translated: ‚Äú Itself‚Äù refers to one‚Äôs own body.

original: shes par bya ba la rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba la rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: ‚Äú Should be known‚Äù means ‚Äúshould be remembered.‚Äù

original: des ni zung 'jug gi rim pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni zung 'jug gi rim pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This explains the stage of union.

original: rim pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'i mtshan @178b nyid can gyi rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'i mtshan @178b nyid can gyi rdzogs pa'i rim pas so //
translated: The stage of Vajra Repetition, etc. is the perfection stage which has the nature of the stage of Vajra Repetition, etc.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs par zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs par zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku'o //
translated: As Vairochana, etc. means as the Great Seal Body of the six Tathagatas.

original: bsam pa ji lta ba'i dbye bas zhes pa ni gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dbye ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba'i dbye bas zhes pa ni gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi dbye ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: According to the various intentions means according to the various habitual tendencies of the passions of delusion, etc.

original: rang gi bdag nyid bskyed pa la //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid bskyed pa la //
translated: Having generated oneself

original: zhes pa ni spros nas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni spros nas so //
translated: means having emanated.

original: bdag gi don bya'o zhes pa la nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te gzhan gyi don kyang bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi don bya'o zhes pa la nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te gzhan gyi don kyang bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should perform one's own aim means that this is merely an illustration, and the meaning is that one should also perform the aims of others.üîΩTherefore, etc.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku rdzogs pa'i rim pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku rdzogs pa'i rim pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
translated: teaches that one should cultivate the Great Seal Body of Vairochana, etc. by means of the perfection stage.

original: / rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa las 'byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i lha'i sku'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa las 'byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang chen po'i lha'i sku'o //
translated: The ‚Äúyoga of Great Vajradhara‚Äù is the deity body of Great Vajradhara arising from the completion stage.

original: 'di nyid ni rim pa lnga'i sgo nas rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni rim pa lnga'i sgo nas rdzogs pa'o //
translated: This is the completion by way of the five stages.

original: brten par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brten par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rang bzhin du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to be supported‚Äù means in order for the nature of the dharmadhatu to be made into the nature of the six tathagatas.

original: gsungs te ni sdud pa po'i tshig ces lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gsungs te ni sdud pa po'i tshig ces lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is said‚Äù is the words of the compiler.

original: 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLuminosity‚Äù is because all things have that as their nature.

original: ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'am mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa ni spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'am mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSamadhi‚Äù is to be attained by the stage of pure mind free from all elaborations or to be attained by the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: de la dmigs pa'o zhes pa ni bsgom par byas nas so //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'o zhes pa ni bsgom par byas nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving that as its object‚Äù means having meditated on it.

original: bskyed pa de ni zhes pa la rdzogs pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin nam rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin du bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bskyed pa de ni zhes pa la rdzogs pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin nam rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin du bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That generation is to be accomplished by the perfection stage as the nature of the exalted body of pristine awareness or the nature of the vajra body.üîΩThe meaning of this is from the explanatory tantra,

original: 'di'i don ni bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud las so //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud las so //
translated: from the Vajra Garland Tantra.

original: aom ni dang por shes par bya //
analyzed: aom ni dang por shes par bya //
translated: Om is to be known as the first.

original: zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: Vairochana is so called

original: de ni aom las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni aom las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he arises from om.

original: dharma zhes bya gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dharma zhes bya gnyis pa'o //
translated: Dharma is the second.

original: zhes pa ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje chos te snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gi rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje chos te snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: Vajra Dharma is the nature of the 84,000 aggregates of Dharma, which is Amitabha.

original: dh'a tu zhes bya gsum par bshad //
analyzed: dh'a tu zhes bya gsum par bshad //
translated: Dhatu is explained as the third.

original: ces pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The nature of all phenomena is the completely pure expanse of reality, which is Akshobhya.

original: sva bh'a bar grags bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sva bh'a bar grags bzhi pa'o //
translated: Sva bha wa is known as the fourth.

original: zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi rang bzhin rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: This is Ratnasa·πÉbhava, the nature of the space element.üîΩƒÄtmƒÅ ka·πÉ

original: a'atma ko&amp ; ni lnga pa yin //
analyzed: a'atma ko&amp ; ni lnga pa yin //
translated: is the fifth.

analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa lnga nye bar sdud par byed pa'i rnam pa can te rdo rje 'chang chen po'o zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: sngags ni dbang po thams cad dang rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bsgom pa'i rnam pa'o //

analyzed: 'di brjod nas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi mos pa byas nas so //
translated: Having uttered this, having imagined the six TathƒÅgatas,

translated: the Tantra of the Continuation of the Continuation of the Compendium of Reality also says:

analyzed: rten te byung ba gang yin pa //

analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes pa ni de dang 'dra ba'i lhag par mos pa byas nas so //

analyzed: sgom pa'i bdag nyid can gyis zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas so //
translated: The one who is of the nature of meditation means the one who is a yogi of the completion stage.

translated: Cultivate means to do the pride of the six Tathagatas of the samadhi of the stage of union. This is the meaning.

analyzed: nges pa'i don ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: de ltar le'u nas brtsams te yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'i lha'i sku'i dbye bas rim pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar le'u nas brtsams te yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'i lha'i sku'i dbye bas rim pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, beginning from the chapter, the two stages are taught by the division of the pure and impure divine body.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su dang po'i sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin dag gis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang de'i lha'i dkyil 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su dang po'i sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin dag gis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang de'i lha'i dkyil 'khor bstan to //
translated: In the direction of the creation stage, the first application and the samadhi of the mandala of the supreme victor teach the five Tathagatas such as Vairochana and their divine mandala.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs su yang rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pas zung du 'jug pa'i bar du rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku rdzogs par bstan to //

translated: Also, in the direction of the perfection stage, the body of Great Vajradhara is taught to be perfected by the stage of vajra repetition and so forth up to union.

original: da ni zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi phyogs gcig phra mo'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba yan lag dang po bstan par bya ba yin no //

translated: Now, the first branch, called subtle yoga, which is one part of the Karma-Uttara-Tantra, which is a branch of the creation stage, is to be taught.

original: rang gi sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni rdul phra rab dang shin tu rags pa'i bsgom pa'i mtha'i bar du sems dbang du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: dgongs pa ni sa 'og bdun gyi bar du khyab par byed pa'i zhabs kyi padma dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du spyi bos khyab pa phyag rnams kyis phyogs bcu dang nam mkha'i dkyil khyab par byed pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i lha'i sku sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas bsgoms na de'i tshe
analyzed: dgongs pa ni sa 'og bdun gyi bar du khyab par byed pa'i zhabs kyi padma dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du spyi bos khyab pa phyag rnams kyis phyogs bcu dang nam mkha'i dkyil khyab par byed pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa'i lha'i sku sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pas bsgoms na de'i tshe
translated: The intention is that when the yogi meditates on the nature of the various divine bodies of Great Vajradhara and so forth, whose lotus feet pervade down to the seven underworlds, whose crown protrudes up to the peak of existence, and whose hands pervade the ten directions and the center of space,

original: rang gi sems brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems brtan par 'gyur ro //

translated: When he meditates on the nature of the three realms, which is as subtle as a mustard seed, as stable and moving, as the nature of the tip of a hair divided a thousand times, as the nature of a drop, at that time his mind will be under control.

original: 'dir ni rdul phra rab bsgom pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rdul phra rab bsgom pa'i gnas skabs yin te /

analyzed: shin tu rags pa'i bsgom pa ni sngar bshad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gsum bsgom pa gsungs te zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i gcig dang gzhan ma gnyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: the yoga of the generation stage, the yoga of the two, the one and the other, and the yoga of the completion stage.

analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gsum pa la yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa nyid kyi'o //

original: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /

translated: In the context of the general meaning, the yoga of the generation stage meditates on the subtle yoga, and in the context of the hidden and ultimate explanations and the definitive meaning to be explained below, the yoga of the completion stage meditates on the subtle yoga.

analyzed: nyin mtshan du ni dus ji srid kyi sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur ba'o //

translated: ‚ÄúWhen the sign of seeing‚Äù and so on means that when the meditation on the drop becomes stable, then the yogin will experience the following signs.

analyzed: rang gi lus mi tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One does not apprehend sounds that are nearby, and one does not feel one‚Äôs own body.

translated: ‚Äú At that time, one‚Äôs own mudra‚Äù refers to the meditation of yogins and yoginƒ´s of Vajra Mind and so on.

analyzed: bsgom pas mi g-yo bar shes nas zhes pa ni bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa dag gcig tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid du shes nas so ;
