original: gal te sgra zhes sgron ma yis //üîΩtha snyad 'di dag mi gsal na //
analyzed: gal te sgra zhes sgron ma yis // tha snyad 'di dag mi gsal na //
translated: If the lamp of soundüîΩdoes not illuminate these conventions,

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: then.üîΩHaving made oneself

original: bdag nyid 'di ltar byas na ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'di ltar byas na ni //
translated: in this way,

original: zhes pa la 'od gsal ba gcig pu las 'byung ba'i yi ge aa'i rang bzhin du byas nas so //
analyzed: zhes pa la 'od gsal ba gcig pu las 'byung ba'i yi ge aa'i rang bzhin du byas nas so //
translated: having made oneself in the nature of the letter A, which arises from the sole clear light,

original: chos kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
analyzed: chos kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
translated: one should draw the Dharma ma·πá·∏çala.

original: zhes pa ni chos kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po'i dkyil 'khor ni me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po'i dkyil 'khor ni me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the four mandalas of the four dharmatƒÅ tathƒÅgatas, which are called the mandalas of fire and so on.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi don du tshig gcig dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi don du tshig gcig dang sbyar ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúmandala‚Äù is applied to the single word ‚Äúfamily.‚Äù

original: de rnams kyi kha dog bshad pa'i phyir dmar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi kha dog bshad pa'i phyir dmar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to explain the colors of those, he says ‚Äúred‚Äù and so on.

original: dmar po ni me'i dkyil 'khor te lkog mar ro //
analyzed: dmar po ni me'i dkyil 'khor te lkog mar ro //
translated: Red is the fire mandala, at the throat.

original: nag po ni rlung dkyil 'khor te lte bar ro //
analyzed: nag po ni rlung dkyil 'khor te lte bar ro //
translated: Black is the wind mandala, at the navel.

original: ser po ni sa'i dkyil 'khor te gsang bar ro //
analyzed: ser po ni sa'i dkyil 'khor te gsang bar ro //
translated: Yellow is the earth mandala, at the perineum.

original: dkar po ni chu'i dkyil 'khor te snying gar ro //
analyzed: dkar po ni chu'i dkyil 'khor te snying gar ro //
translated: White is the water mandala, at the heart.

original: mdor bsdus pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i ngo bo yin pas so //üîΩbzhi bzhi yi ni sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i ngo bo yin pas so // bzhi bzhi yi ni sbyor ba yis //
translated: In brief, they are the nature of the four great elements.üîΩBy the application of four by four,

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor re re la yang cha bzhis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor re re la yang cha bzhis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: each mandala is pervaded by four parts.

original: de la lkog ma'i dkyil 'khor me'i khams kyi ngo bo yang sa dang chu dang rlung gi khams kyi chas khyab pa'o //üîΩsnying ga'i dkyil 'khor chu'i khams kyi ngo bo yang sa dang me dang rlung gi khams kyi chas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de la lkog ma'i dkyil 'khor me'i khams kyi ngo bo yang sa dang chu dang rlung gi khams kyi chas khyab pa'o // snying ga'i dkyil 'khor chu'i khams kyi ngo bo yang sa dang me dang rlung gi khams kyi chas khyab pa'o //
translated: The mandala of the throat, which is the essence of the fire element, is pervaded by the parts of the earth, water, and wind elements.üîΩThe mandala of the heart, which is the essence of the water element, is pervaded by the parts of the earth, fire, and wind elements.

original: lte ba'i dkyil 'khor rlung gi rang bzhin yang sa dang me dang chu'i khams kyi chas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i dkyil 'khor rlung gi rang bzhin yang sa dang me dang chu'i khams kyi chas khyab pa'o //
translated: The mandala of the navel, which is the nature of wind, is pervaded by the parts of the earth, fire, and water elements.

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor sa'i rang bzhin yang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams kyi chas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor sa'i rang bzhin yang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams kyi chas khyab pa'o //
translated: The mandala of the secret place, which is the nature of earth, is pervaded by the parts of the water, fire, and wind elements.

original: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po rnams ni phan tshun med par mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po rnams ni phan tshun med par mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The great elements of earth and so on are related to each other in the sense that they do not occur without each other.

original: byas pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the case of being produced and being impermanent.

original: gos dkar la sogs legs par bri //
analyzed: gos dkar la sogs legs par bri //
translated: Draw the excellent white cloth and so on.

original: zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po'i btsun mo khams bzhir byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po'i btsun mo khams bzhir byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means the four Tathagatas, Amitabha and so on, are the consecration of the four constituents as the queens.

original: sa ni spyan ma zhes pa ste //
analyzed: sa ni spyan ma zhes pa ste //
translated: Earth is Locana,

original: chu yi khams ni m'a ma k'i //
analyzed: chu yi khams ni m'a ma k'i //
translated: the water constituent is Mamaki,

original: gos dkar ma ni mer bshad pa //
analyzed: gos dkar ma ni mer bshad pa //
translated: the fire constituent is Pandara,

original: rlung ni sgrol mar rab tu grags //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rlung ni sgrol mar rab tu grags // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and the wind constituent is Tara.

original: de yi dbus su rang gi lha //
analyzed: de yi dbus su rang gi lha //
translated: In the middle of that, one's deity,

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bzhi po'i nang na rang gi lta ste 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa dang don yod grub pa dang / rin chen 'byung @187b ldan gyi byin gyis brlabs par shes par bya ste /üîΩ'dir ni padma'i mgon po lha //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bzhi po'i nang na rang gi lta ste 'od dpag tu med pa dang mi bskyod pa dang don yod grub pa dang / rin chen 'byung @187b ldan gyi byin gyis brlabs par shes par bya ste / 'dir ni padma'i mgon po lha //
translated: one should know that in the middle of the four mandalas, one's deity is the consecration of Amitabha, Akshobhya, Amoghasiddhi, and Ratnasambhava.üîΩHere, it is explained as:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lord of the lotus, and so on.

original: sbyor ba bzhi yi go 'phang mchog / ces pa ni gru gsum dang zlum po dang gzhu'i dbyibs dang gru bzhi pa dang lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba'i gnas dang / dmar po dang nag po dang ser po dang dkar po'i kha dog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi yi go 'phang mchog / ces pa ni gru gsum dang zlum po dang gzhu'i dbyibs dang gru bzhi pa dang lkog ma dang snying ga dang lte ba dang gsang ba'i gnas dang / dmar po dang nag po dang ser po dang dkar po'i kha dog la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the colors red, black, yellow, and white, and so on.üîΩAbove, in the corners, in the middle, and below.

original: steng dang zur dang mnyam dang 'og / ces pa ni steng ni lkog ma'o //üîΩzur ni snying ga'o //
analyzed: steng dang zur dang mnyam dang 'og / ces pa ni steng ni lkog ma'o // zur ni snying ga'o //
translated: Above is the throat.üîΩIn the corners is the heart.

original: mnyam pa ni lte ba'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni lte ba'o //
translated: In the middle is the navel.

original: 'og ni gsang ba'o //
analyzed: 'og ni gsang ba'o //
translated: Below is the secret place.

original: yang na steng ni me'i dkyil 'khor g-yas pa'i sgo nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na steng ni me'i dkyil 'khor g-yas pa'i sgo nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, above is the fire ma·πá·∏çala that arises from the right nostril.

original: zur ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor g-yon nas rgyu ba'o //üîΩmnyam pa ni chu'i dkyil 'khor gnyis ka las rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: zur ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor g-yon nas rgyu ba'o // mnyam pa ni chu'i dkyil 'khor gnyis ka las rgyu ba'o //
translated: In the corners is the wind ma·πá·∏çala that moves through the left.üîΩIn the middle is the water ma·πá·∏çala that moves through both.

original: 'og ni sa'i dkyil 'khor gnyis ka kho na las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'og ni sa'i dkyil 'khor gnyis ka kho na las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Below is the earth ma·πá·∏çala that arises from both.

original: gos dkar la sogs zhes pa ni gos dkar la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhis nye bar mtshon pa'i dkyil 'khor pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: gos dkar la sogs zhes pa ni gos dkar la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhis nye bar mtshon pa'i dkyil 'khor pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: The white-clad ones and so on means the four goddesses such as white-clad, and so on, who are the four mandala-deities.

original: / ji bzhin du zhes pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / ji bzhin du zhes pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As it is means in the same order.

original: me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang chu ste zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rnams kyi gnas kyi rim pas ni ma yin gyi //
analyzed: me dang rlung dang dbang chen dang chu ste zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rnams kyi gnas kyi rim pas ni ma yin gyi //
translated: Fire, wind, earth, and water means that the order of the mandalas is not by the order of the abodes,

original: 'on kyang rlung rab tu rgyu ba'i rim pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rlung rab tu rgyu ba'i rim pas so //
translated: but rather by the order of the movement of the winds.

original: de la thun dang por me'i dkyil 'khor g-yas pa las rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de la thun dang por me'i dkyil 'khor g-yas pa las rgyu ba'o //
translated: In the first period, the fire mandala moves from the right.

original: thun gnyis pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni g-yon las rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: thun gnyis pa la rlung gi dkyil 'khor ni g-yon las rgyu ba'o //
translated: In the second period, the wind mandala moves from the left.

original: thun gsum pa la sa'i dkyil 'khor gnyi ga las rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: thun gsum pa la sa'i dkyil 'khor gnyi ga las rgyu ba'o //
translated: In the third period, the earth mandala moves from both.

original: thun bzhi pa la chu'i dkyil 'khor dal bus dman pa gnyi ga las rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: thun bzhi pa la chu'i dkyil 'khor dal bus dman pa gnyi ga las rgyu ba'o //
translated: In the fourth period, the water mandala moves slowly and weakly from both.

original: so so'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i rim gyis rgyu ba'i nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes pa ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i rim gyis rgyu ba'i nyi shu rtsa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The individual ma·πá·∏çalas are the twenty-four, which move by day and night through the process of entering, abiding, and rising.

original: rgyu ba de rnams kyi nyi khri chig stong drug brgyar rlung gi grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba de rnams kyi nyi khri chig stong drug brgyar rlung gi grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The number of those movements is twenty-one thousand six hundred.

original: gos dkar la sogs bzlas bshad pa //
analyzed: gos dkar la sogs bzlas bshad pa //
translated: The recitation of PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´ and so forth

original: brgya phrag gnyis dang nyi shu lnga //
analyzed: brgya phrag gnyis dang nyi shu lnga //
translated: is explained as two hundred and twenty-five.

original: bzhi po legs par bsgres pas na //üîΩsbyor bzhi bsdus pas brgya phrag dgu //
analyzed: bzhi po legs par bsgres pas na // sbyor bzhi bsdus pas brgya phrag dgu //
translated: When those four are multiplied,

original: dgu brgya dag tu gang bshad pa//
analyzed: dgu brgya dag tu gang bshad pa//
translated: the total is nine hundred.üîΩWhen those nine hundred

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rim pa yis //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rim pa yis //
translated: are gathered by the process of twenty-four,

original: legs par bsdus te de dag ni //
analyzed: legs par bsdus te de dag ni //
translated: they are well gathered

original: nyi khri chig stong drug brgyar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyi khri chig stong drug brgyar 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: into twenty-one thousand six hundred.

original: de la don bsdus pa ni gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par 'dod pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug ste @188a * //
analyzed: de la don bsdus pa ni gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom par 'dod pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba la 'jug ste @188a * //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: A yogin of the deluded type who wishes to cultivate the yoga of the subtle stage enters into clear light by the process of purifying the mind.

original: de las bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku dmigs la /
analyzed: de las bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku dmigs la /
translated: From that, visualize the body of pristine consciousness through the stage of self-consecration.üîΩMeditate on the wheel of the dharmadhƒÅtu with eight spokes in the navel all at once.üîΩIn the center of that, imagine the blazing syllable at the beginning.

original: lte ba'i phyogs su rtsibs brgyad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo cig char du bsgom zhing de'i lte bar dang po yi ge 'bar ba bsams te de'i me stag dang 'dra ba'i ra la sogs pa yi ge bzhi'i lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas las spros te
analyzed: lte ba'i phyogs su rtsibs brgyad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo cig char du bsgom zhing de'i lte bar dang po yi ge 'bar ba bsams te de'i me stag dang 'dra ba'i ra la sogs pa yi ge bzhi'i lkog ma la sogs pa'i gnas las spros te
translated: The sparks from that fire are like the four syllables ra and so on.üîΩThose emanate from the place of the throat, and so on.

original: / de yongs su gyur pa las me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi bsgoms la /
analyzed: / de yongs su gyur pa las me la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi bsgoms la /
translated: Meditate on the four ma·πá·∏çalas of fire, and so on.

original: kha dog dmar po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang g-yas pa la sogs pa'i sgo'i dbye bas 'od zer gyi tshogs spros te /
analyzed: kha dog dmar po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang g-yas pa la sogs pa'i sgo'i dbye bas 'od zer gyi tshogs spros te /
translated: Emanate the assembly of light rays through the divisions of the colors, such as red, and the divisions of the right and left doors.

original: de nyid sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus 'dzin nas brtan pa'i rtags mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas spro ba dang bsdu ba byas la /
analyzed: de nyid sna'i rtse mor thun phyed phyed kyi dus 'dzin nas brtan pa'i rtags mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas spro ba dang bsdu ba byas la /
translated: Having held that at the tip of the nose for half a session, emanate and gather, preceded by seeing the signs of stability.

original: 'bad rtsol med par zhi ba la sogs pa bsgrubs la ji srid sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ba de srid kyi bar du gnas par bya'o zhes gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa bstan to
analyzed: 'bad rtsol med par zhi ba la sogs pa bsgrubs la ji srid sems rtse gcig par 'gyur ba de srid kyi bar du gnas par bya'o zhes gti mug gi rigs can gyi rnal 'byor pa'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa bstan to
translated: Thus, the meditation on the subtle yoga from the perspective of the completion stage of the deluded type of yogi/nƒ´ has been taught.

original: // de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa bstan pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni gcig ste /
analyzed: // de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa bstan pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni gcig ste /
translated: Thus, the meditation on the subtle yoga of the three types of yogis/yoginƒ´s of the completion stage, and the single one of the yogis/yoginƒ´s of the generation stage,üîΩhas been taught by the BhagavƒÅn in brief.

original: mdor bsdus pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te zhes pa ni sdud pa po'i chig go //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te zhes pa ni sdud pa po'i chig go //
translated: This is the statement of the compiler.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i rgyur gyur pa phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i rgyur gyur pa phra mo'i rnal 'byor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definitive meaning is taught because the subtle yoga, which is the cause of the stage of vajra repetition, has been taught.

original: rlung gi de nyid rim gyis ni //
analyzed: rlung gi de nyid rim gyis ni //
translated: The reality of the winds is gradual,üîΩand the reality of the mantra is engaged.

original: sngags kyi de nyid yang dag 'jug / sngags kyi bskyed pa rtogs nas ni //
analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid yang dag 'jug / sngags kyi bskyed pa rtogs nas ni //
translated: Having realized the generation of the mantra,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa rnams la slob //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa rnams la slob //
translated: One should train in the vajra repetition.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: sgron ma gsal ba'i t'i k'a las le'u gsum pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal ba'i t'i k'a las le'u gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third chapter of the Illuminating Lamp.

original: // / lha'i sku yang dag par thob pas gzhan rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o zhes bya bas lha la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bzhi pa'i bshad pa rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: // / lha'i sku yang dag par thob pas gzhan rnams rjes su gzung ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o zhes bya bas lha la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bzhi pa'i bshad pa rtsom par byed de /
translated: In order to benefit others by attaining the perfect body of the deity, one should draw the ma·πá·∏çala. Thus, beginning with observing the deity, the explanation of the fourth chapter is begun.

original: lha la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas zhes pa ni le'u gsum pa nas gsungs pa'i dang po'i sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i lha'i sku bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: lha la dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas zhes pa ni le'u gsum pa nas gsungs pa'i dang po'i sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gnyis kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i lha'i sku bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: Preceded by observing the deity means preceded by the meditation on the deity's body to be accomplished by the two, the first yoga and the samƒÅdhi of the supreme victor ma·πá·∏çala, taught in the third chapter.

original: // phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pas zhes pa ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa //
analyzed: // phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pas zhes pa ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa //
translated: By meditating on the subtle yoga is one part of the samƒÅdhi of the supreme victor activity.

original: phyag rgya'i padma'i nang du thig le bsgom pa dang sna rtser gsum la thig le la bsgom pas so //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i padma'i nang du thig le bsgom pa dang sna rtser gsum la thig le la bsgom pas so //
translated: By meditating on the drop in the lotus of the seal, and by meditating on the drop at the tip of the nose, one obtains the special attainment.

original: khyad par thob pas zhes pa ni @188b sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir lung bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: khyad par thob pas zhes pa ni @188b sems rtse gcig pa nyid thob pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir lung bstan pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú Having obtained the special attainment‚Äù means that one has obtained the one-pointed mind, and that the Tathagatas prophesy that one will work for the welfare of beings.

original: slob ma rnams la rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba'i phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: slob ma rnams la rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du dbang bskur ba'i phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú In order to confer initiation on the disciples in the colored-powder mandala‚Äù means

original: mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du rig pa'i dbang la sogs pa bskur pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor du rig pa'i dbang la sogs pa bskur pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: that in the colored-powder mandala endowed with the symbolic seal, one confers the knowledge-initiation and so forth.

original: / des na don 'di yin te phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i sgo nas sems la dbang thob pa'i slob dpon gyis thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du slob ma la dbang bskur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / des na don 'di yin te phra mo'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa'i sgo nas sems la dbang thob pa'i slob dpon gyis thugs kyi dkyil 'khor du slob ma la dbang bskur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that the master who has obtained control over the mind by means of cultivating the subtle yoga confers initiation on the disciple in the mind mandala.

original: bla ma la gsol ba 'debs pa'i cho ga zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon la dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i phyir slob mas zhu ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bla ma la gsol ba 'debs pa'i cho ga zhes pa ni rdo rje slob dpon la dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i phyir slob mas zhu ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The rite of supplicating the guru is the meaning of the disciple's request to the vajra master in order to enter the mandala.

original: sgra ji bzhin par ni sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin par ni sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand by the word etc. that it is just as the words say.

original: mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i nang nas thugs rdo rje gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i sgo nas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i nang nas thugs rdo rje gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase from the point of view of Akshobhya is because of the preeminence of the vajra mind among the five transcendent ones.

original: bstod pas ni bstod pa byas nas so //
analyzed: bstod pas ni bstod pa byas nas so //
translated: Having praised with the praise,

original: mnyes par byed pa zhes pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa'o//
analyzed: mnyes par byed pa zhes pa ni gsol ba 'debs pa'o//
translated: pleasing means supplicating.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis so zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib ba'i spros pa zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nam zhi ba'i phrin las mdzad pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis so zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib ba'i spros pa zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nam zhi ba'i phrin las mdzad pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The phrase by means of the nature of Vairochana is because of the nature of mirror-like pristine awareness, which has the characteristic of the pacification of the elaborations of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, or because of the nature of the activity of pacification.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od gsal ba las byung ba rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin te 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od gsal ba las byung ba rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin te 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
translated: The nature of the purity of the four great elements, which are the light of all the Tathagatas, is the Tathagata.

original: de rnams kyi gnas ni bskyed pa'i gnas te nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnas ni bskyed pa'i gnas te nam mkha'o //
translated: Their abode is the place of generation, which is space.

original: de'i ngo bo ni rin chen 'byung ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni rin chen 'byung ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Its essence is the meaning of the name Ratnasa·πÉbhava.

original: mdo sde la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis kyi gsung rab ni chos kun te de'i rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa zhes pa ni ngag rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis kyi gsung rab ni chos kun te de'i rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin 'od dpag tu med pa zhes pa ni ngag rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The Dharma is the scriptures of the twelve branches, such as the s≈´tras, etc. The nature of the purity of that is AmitƒÅbha, because it is the essence of the purity of speech.

original: yang na chos kun ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na chos kun ni sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Or else, the Dharma is the nature of the world of sentient beings and the world of the container.

original: de rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyu yin te rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyu yin te rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the enlightenment mind of those is Ak·π£obhya, because cause and effect are inseparable.

original: chos thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo 'od dpag tu med pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo 'od dpag tu med pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the nature of AmitƒÅbha, the thought of enlightenment which is the cause of all dharmas.

original: yang na chos kun ni chos thams cad rab tu byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te de'i rang bzhin de nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na chos kun ni chos thams cad rab tu byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te de'i rang bzhin de nyid yin no //
translated: Or else, all dharmas are the discriminative awareness which has the characteristic of the performance of all dharmas, and that is its nature.

original: bdag med pa'i zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang ngo //
translated: The supreme selflessness is the state of Vajradhara.

original: mchog gi @189a * //üîΩkhams gsum la bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyis de thob par byed pas na bdag med pa mchog ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi @189a * // khams gsum la bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes kyis de thob par byed pas na bdag med pa mchog ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The supreme

original: yang mchog ni g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi rlung gi khams te /
analyzed: yang mchog ni g-yo ba'i rang bzhin gyi rlung gi khams te /
translated: is the wind element which is of the nature of movement.

original: de nyid rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas dbang du byed cing mi snang bar byed pas na /
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas dbang du byed cing mi snang bar byed pas na /
translated: That is brought under control and made invisible by the stage of vajra repetition.

original: bdag med de bdag med mchog ni don yod grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med de bdag med mchog ni don yod grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the supreme selflessness is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rlung gi khams rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gi khams rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because of the purification of the wind element.

original: rigs gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas rigs gsum la bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar te zhes pa ni bya ba dang byed pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas rigs gsum la bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar sbyar te zhes pa ni bya ba dang byed pa'i tshig go /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the nature of the three families‚Äù is connected to the phrase ‚Äúbecause Ratnasa·πÉbha and Amoghasiddhi are included in the three families by the reasoning explained above.‚Äù

original: de skad du bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan dang zhes pa ni 'og nas bshad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan dang zhes pa ni 'og nas bshad pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe name of the ma·πá·∏çala explained in this way‚Äù refers to the characteristics explained below.

original: chad pa dang lhag pa'i zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni khru tshad bcu gnyis bya ba yin gyi de las chad pa khru bcu gcig la sogs pa dang / de las lhag pa khru bcu gsum la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chad pa dang lhag pa'i zhes pa ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor ni khru tshad bcu gnyis bya ba yin gyi de las chad pa khru bcu gcig la sogs pa dang / de las lhag pa khru bcu gsum la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdeficiency and excess‚Äù means that the mind ma·πá·∏çala should be twelve cubits, and less than that is eleven cubits, and so on, and more than that is thirteen cubits, and so on.

original: nyes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault is that it is not taught by the BhagavƒÅn MahƒÅvajradhara.

original: bral ba zhes pa ni de med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bral ba zhes pa ni de med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfree from‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout that.‚Äù

original: sku'i mchog ces pa ni sku rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku'i mchog ces pa ni sku rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The ‚Äúbest of bodies‚Äù is the nature of the pure body, which is called Vairocana.

original: des ni sku'i rigs kyi gtso bos rdo rje slob dpon la bstod pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sku'i rigs kyi gtso bos rdo rje slob dpon la bstod pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the praise of the vajra master by the chief of the body family.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la nges par 'byung ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la nges par 'byung ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEmerges from the ultimate truth‚Äù means that the phenomena of affliction and purification arise from the clear light.

original: ji skad du //üîΩji ltar chu klung dang ba las //
analyzed: ji skad du // ji ltar chu klung dang ba las //
translated: As it is said:üîΩJust as fish quickly leap out

original: nya dag myur du ldang ba bzhin //üîΩthams cad stong pa'i dang ba las //
analyzed: nya dag myur du ldang ba bzhin // thams cad stong pa'i dang ba las //
translated: of clear water,üîΩso the net of illusions arises

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba de bzhin 'byung /üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba de bzhin 'byung / zhes bshad do //
translated: from the clarity of everything empty.

original: snang ba gsum po zhes pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi tshor ba gsum dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: snang ba gsum po zhes pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang btang snyoms kyi tshor ba gsum dang ldan pa'i kun gzhi la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum mo //
translated: The ‚Äúthree appearances‚Äù are the three consciousnesses of the ground-of-all, which are endowed with the three feelings of pleasure, pain, and neutrality.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ste zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po'i ngo bo ste spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ste zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa de rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po'i ngo bo ste spyod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment and so forth‚Äù is the nature of the aggregate of compositional factors, which are mental factors of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral minds of those consciousnesses, that is, their conduct.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum gyi chos dang / thabs kyi rang bzhin bcu dang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum gyi chos dang / thabs kyi rang bzhin bcu dang ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun te /
translated: Attachment and so forth are the thirty-three factors of the nature of wisdom, the ten factors of the nature of method, and the seven factors of the nature of ignorance.

original: nyin dang mtshan du brgya bcu gnyis gyur nas brgya drug cur @189b 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du brgya bcu gnyis gyur nas brgya drug cur @189b 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They become one hundred and twenty in a day and night, and they become one hundred and sixty.

original: de rnams kyang rang bzhin zhes pa ni brgya drug cu'i grangs dang ldan pa'o //üîΩmngon par byang chub par bsgoms pas zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang rang bzhin zhes pa ni brgya drug cu'i grangs dang ldan pa'o // mngon par byang chub par bsgoms pas zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas so //
translated: Those are also said to be ‚Äúnatural,‚Äù endowed with the number of one hundred and sixty.üîΩ‚ÄúMeditated on the manifest enlightenment‚Äù is the process of purifying the mind through the stages of mantra and mudra.

original: rnam par sbyong bar mdzad pas na //
analyzed: rnam par sbyong bar mdzad pas na //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of purifying‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni mi snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: is making them invisible.

original: ye shes spyod pa rnam sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes spyod pa rnam sbyong ba'o //
translated: One purifies the conduct of intuition.

original: zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one realizes the reality of the clearlight transparency which is pure by nature.üîΩHaving attained mastery of all,

original: thams cad kyi dbang phyug brnyes pas na zhes pa ni sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa'i phyir dang phra ba la sogs pa'i sgyu 'phrul brgyad thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi dbang phyug brnyes pas na zhes pa ni sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa'i phyir dang phra ba la sogs pa'i sgyu 'phrul brgyad thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that one has attained the eight qualities such as mastery of body, and the eight magical powers such as subtlety.

original: de tshe dbang phyug kun thob nas //
analyzed: de tshe dbang phyug kun thob nas //
translated: Then, having attained mastery of all,

original: rdo rje sku ni mgu bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje sku ni mgu bar 'gyur //
translated: the vajra body is satisfied.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated.

original: ngag gi dbang phyug brnyes pas na //
analyzed: ngag gi dbang phyug brnyes pas na //
translated: Having attained mastery of speech,

original: zhes pa ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ngag gi dbang phyug ste dbang du gyur cing mngon du byas pa de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i tshangs pa'i dbyangs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ngag gi dbang phyug ste dbang du gyur cing mngon du byas pa de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that one has attained the mastery of speech, which is characterized by the Brahma voice endowed with sixty qualities, and has actualized it.

original: des ni gsung gi rang bzhin gyi 'od dpag tu med pa'i sgo nas rdo rje slob dpon la bstod pa bstan to //üîΩsems can thams cad kyi sems ni rdo rje nyid pas na zhes pa ni sems can thams cad de rigs bzhi las byung ba'i 'gro ba rigs drug las //
analyzed: des ni gsung gi rang bzhin gyi 'od dpag tu med pa'i sgo nas rdo rje slob dpon la bstod pa bstan to // sems can thams cad kyi sems ni rdo rje nyid pas na zhes pa ni sems can thams cad de rigs bzhi las byung ba'i 'gro ba rigs drug las //
translated: This shows the praise of the vajra master by way of the nature of speech, AmitƒÅbha.üîΩSince the mind of all sentient beings is vajra,

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the mind of all sentient beings is the nature of the aggregate of consciousness, which is to be realized by the direct perception of reflexive awareness, because it is the nature of purity.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams rnam par dpyad nas dmigs su med pas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams rnam par dpyad nas dmigs su med pas zhes pa ni /
translated: Since desire and so on are not observed when analyzed,

analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa dang / bdag kyang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: all phenomena are pure by nature, and the self is also pure by nature.üîΩSince it is free from the stains of desire and so on,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral bas ni zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin brgya drug cu dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral bas ni zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin brgya drug cu dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is free from the one hundred and sixty natural [natures].

original: de na khams gsum pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid dang sems kyang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes de med pas sems las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ga la
analyzed: de na khams gsum pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid dang sems kyang stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes de med pas sems las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ga la
translated: afflictions and branch afflictions, such as attachment, which are the nature of phenomena arisen from mind?

original: yod de / chos can yod na chos rnams la 'jig rten pa'i bsam pa 'jug pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod de / chos can yod na chos rnams la 'jig rten pa'i bsam pa 'jug pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúIf there is a phenomenon, worldly thoughts engage with phenomena.‚Äù

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan las kyang / dbang po'i tshogs la chags pa med //
translated: Similarly, another text says:üîΩThe collection of sense faculties is not attached

original: don la ma yin sems la min //
analyzed: don la ma yin sems la min //
translated: To objects, to mind,

analyzed: gzhan dang bdag @190a * // la'ang mi dmigs te //
translated: To self or other.

analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab 'brel ba yis //

analyzed: rgyu can sems kyi 'khrul pa las // sprin gyi bu ga gang las kyang //
translated: From the confusion of the mind that has causes,üîΩLightning strikes like fire

analyzed: thog ni me ltar 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: From any hole in the clouds.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And also:

translated: Attachment is the realization of one‚Äôs mind.

analyzed: mun pa zhe sdang lus can gyi //
translated: The darkness of anger, the body of

original: brdzun pa'i bdag nyid byis pa yis //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i bdag nyid byis pa yis //
translated: The false self of the childish

original: gang dag chos rnams brtag pa ste //
analyzed: gang dag chos rnams brtag pa ste //
translated: Are the conceptualizations of phenomena

analyzed: don dam rnam rtog la yang ni //
translated: By the ultimate, even by the conceptualizations

analyzed: mkhas pas zhen par mi bya'o // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The wise do not cling.

original: zhi ba'i lha'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: zhi ba'i lha'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: Santideva also says:

original: nyon mongs yul la med cing dbang po'i tshogs la'ang med la bar yang mi gnas te //
analyzed: nyon mongs yul la med cing dbang po'i tshogs la'ang med la bar yang mi gnas te //
translated: The afflictions do not exist in the object, nor in the collection of the sense faculties, nor do they abide between them.

analyzed: de las gzhan du ma yin gar gnas 'on kyang de yis 'gro ba thams cad bcom par byed //
translated: They do not exist elsewhere, nor do they abide anywhere, yet they destroy all living beings.

analyzed: 'di ni sgyu ma yin gyi de phyir sems kyi 'jigs pa 'dor zhing rtsol ba brten par gyis //

original: shes rab kyis ni don du don med pas ni dmyal bar bdag nyid ci phyir gnod par byed //üîΩces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni don du don med pas ni dmyal bar bdag nyid ci phyir gnod par byed //üîΩces bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why do you, through wisdom, harm yourself in the hells for the sake of an object that is ultimately unreal?

original: de nyid kyis na kun du bzang po'i zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral bas thog ma dang tha ma dang bar mar dge ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na kun du bzang po'i zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral bas thog ma dang tha ma dang bar mar dge ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, Samantabhadra means that he is virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end, because he is free from all the stains of the afflictions.

original: rang gi thugs so sor thugs su chud pas na zhes pa la rang gi sems phra mo'i bsgom pa dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i bsgom pa'i sgo nas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa ni rang gi thugs so sor thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi thugs so sor thugs su chud pas na zhes pa la rang gi sems phra mo'i bsgom pa dang sngags dang phyag rgya'i bsgom pa'i sgo nas 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa ni rang gi thugs so sor thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: Because he has realized his own mind, means that he has realized the reality of clear light by means of the meditation on the subtle mind and the meditation on the mantra and the seal.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang rigs kyi bu rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par zhog la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang rigs kyi bu rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par zhog la zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Root Tantra also says, Son of the family, contemplate your own mind and rest in equipoise.

original: yid mi bde las rnam grol ba'i //
analyzed: yid mi bde las rnam grol ba'i //
translated: Free from mental unhappiness,

original: rnam rtog mun pa sel byed pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog mun pa sel byed pa //
translated: dispelling the darkness of conceptualization,

original: nyon mongs dri ma las dag pa'i //
analyzed: nyon mongs dri ma las dag pa'i //
translated: purified from the stains of the afflictions,

original: zla ba bzhin du sems zla'o //
analyzed: zla ba bzhin du sems zla'o //
translated: the mind is the moon, like the moon.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang //
translated: And likewise the Root Tantra says:

original: bcom ldan 'das zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'i sems bdag gis mthong ngo zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba'i sems bdag gis mthong ngo zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is seen by me with a mind like the orb of the moon.üîΩSince he causes all sentient beings to attain nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni 'gro ba rigs drug pa'i sems can thams cad brtan pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa chen po'i mtshan nyid kyi grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i phyir
analyzed: sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni 'gro ba rigs drug pa'i sems can thams cad brtan pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa chen po'i mtshan nyid kyi grong khyer chen po la 'jug pa'i phyir
translated: he causes all sentient beings of the six kinds of living beings to enter the great city that has the characteristic of the great liberation of being stabilized, ripened, and so on.

original: ro // dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi @190b rdo rje 'chang gi ji lta ba bzhin du de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro // dgongs pa ma yin pa'o zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi @190b rdo rje 'chang gi ji lta ba bzhin du de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-intentional is the teaching of reality just as it is of Vajradhara of Body, Speech, and Mind.

original: sdud pa po ni lag na rdo rjes so //
analyzed: sdud pa po ni lag na rdo rjes so //
translated: The compiler is VajrapƒÅ·πái.üîΩSince he teaches in accordance with the inclinations of those to be tamed,

original: gdul bya rnams la ci rigs par rjes su ston par mdzad pas na zhes pa la bsam pa ji lta ba dang rigs ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa la sogs pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gdul bya rnams la ci rigs par rjes su ston par mdzad pas na zhes pa la bsam pa ji lta ba dang rigs ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa la sogs pas sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: he acts for the welfare of sentient beings by teaching in accordance with their inclinations and their type.

original: / ji skad du /
analyzed: / ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ri bong stag dang seng ge dang // glang po rnams kyi skye bar yang //
analyzed: ri bong stag dang seng ge dang // glang po rnams kyi skye bar yang //
translated: And in the births of rabbits, tigers, lions, and elephants,

original: thugs rje'i thugs dang ldan pa yis //
analyzed: thugs rje'i thugs dang ldan pa yis //
translated: The one endowed with the mind of compassion

original: phyag rgya grub par skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyag rgya grub par skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Will be born with the seal of accomplishment.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags gnyis dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags gnyis dang bral ba'i de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Nondual intuition is the reality free from the two habitual propensities of the notional attachment to the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de la dngos po 'di dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir te gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes sbyor ba gcig go //
analyzed: de la dngos po 'di dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir te gzugs brnyan bzhin no zhes sbyor ba gcig go //
translated: Here, these entities are empty of intrinsic reality, because they are devoid of singularity and plurality, like a reflection. This is one syllogism.

original: gnyis pa yang re zhig dang po gcig dang du ma la sogs pas rnam par dpyad na med pas 'dzin par gyur pa'i sems kyang med de /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang re zhig dang po gcig dang du ma la sogs pas rnam par dpyad na med pas 'dzin par gyur pa'i sems kyang med de /
translated: The second syllogism is: First, since there is no existence in terms of singularity, plurality, etc., the mind that becomes the apprehender also does not exist,

original: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the apprehended does not exist, the apprehender does not exist.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang bral bas rang bzhin med pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te de 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang bral bas rang bzhin med pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te de 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: Since it is free from the two kinds of discriminations, subject and object, it is non-substantiality, which is the non-dual intuition. Since he holds that, he is the Vajra-Holder.

original: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa dag / rnam pa gnyis ni blo med pa //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin pa dag / rnam pa gnyis ni blo med pa //
translated: The subject and object, the two aspects, are absent from the mind.

original: gang zhig tha dad med pa ste //
analyzed: gang zhig tha dad med pa ste //
translated: That which is non-dual

original: de ni zung 'jug bshad pa yin //
analyzed: de ni zung 'jug bshad pa yin //
translated: is explained as the union.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩde ltar na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rnam grangs can //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo // de ltar na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi rnam grangs can //
translated: Thus it is.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the one who is the possessor of the synonyms of the realm of non-abiding nirvana, who is free from the discriminations of subject and object, who abides in the samadhi of union, is called the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: sa 'og dang sa steng dang mtho ris kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na zhes pa la pha rol gyi bstan pa la grags pas 'jig rten gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og dang sa steng dang mtho ris kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na zhes pa la pha rol gyi bstan pa la grags pas 'jig rten gsum pa'o //
translated: Since he is the essence of the netherworld, the earth, and heaven, he is the three worlds, known in the teachings of others.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa zhes pa ni rang gi bstan pa la grags pas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa ste khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa zhes pa ni rang gi bstan pa la grags pas 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa ste khams gsum pa'o //
translated: The desire realm and so forth refers to the three realms, the desire, form, and formless realms, which are renowned in one's own teaching.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das te 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs pas na 'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das te 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhugs pas na 'o //
translated: The one who abides in the nature of those is the BhagavƒÅn, because he abides in the nature of the desire realm and so forth.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi sgras lha'i rigs drug ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi sgras lha'i rigs drug ste /
translated: The three worlds are the six types of gods.

original: de rnams kyi nang na @191a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang na @191a * //
translated: Among them,

original: mchog ni drag po dang khyab 'jug dang dbyig snying la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni drag po dang khyab 'jug dang dbyig snying la sogs pa'o //
translated: the supreme are ≈öiva, Vi·π£·πáu, Skanda, and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi nang na yang lung bstan pa nyid kyi rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang na yang lung bstan pa nyid kyi rdo rje dang 'dra bas na rdo rje ste /
translated: Among them, he is also the vajra, because he is like a vajra due to his very nature of being prophesied.

original: rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The solitary realizers and so forth are the hearers, solitary realizers, and perfect buddhas.üîΩAmong them, he is the supreme, the principal one.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni gtso bor gyur pas so zhes pa la thams cad kyi mchog ni dpal rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni gtso bor gyur pas so zhes pa la thams cad kyi mchog ni dpal rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The supreme of all is glorious Vajradhara.

original: 'jig rten gsum mchog ni zhes pa la tshangs pa la sogs pa ste mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa dang / dpal rdo rje 'chang gi sprul pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum mchog ni zhes pa la tshangs pa la sogs pa ste mngon par shes pa lnga thob pa dang / dpal rdo rje 'chang gi sprul pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three worlds are supreme means Brahma and so forth, who have attained the five superknowledges, and are the essence of the emanations of glorious Vajradhara.

original: de rnams la rjes su brten pa nyid de zhes pa ni rang gi phyogs las bkag cing theg pa chen po'i lam la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la rjes su brten pa nyid de zhes pa ni rang gi phyogs las bkag cing theg pa chen po'i lam la 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are the ones who rely on that means they are blocked from their own position and enter the path of the Mahayana.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams kyi skyes bu la sogs pa'i yod pa'i lta ba log par rtogs pa gang yin pa de las ldog cing yang dag pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi gang dag dang chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams kyi skyes bu la sogs pa'i yod pa'i lta ba log par rtogs pa gang yin pa de las ldog cing yang dag pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi gang dag dang chos la bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro
translated: Because they turn away from the wrong understanding of the existence of a person and so forth, and enter into the reality of the selflessness of phenomena, which is the characteristic of the correct path.

original: // 'jig rten 'di la bden pa gang //
analyzed: // 'jig rten 'di la bden pa gang //
translated: What is true in this world

original: tshangs pa la sogs rnams kyis bstan //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs rnams kyis bstan //
translated: was taught by Brahma and so forth.

original: 'phags pas de nyid brdzun bshad de //
analyzed: 'phags pas de nyid brdzun bshad de //
translated: The noble ones say that is false,

original: de las lhag ma gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: de las lhag ma gzhan ci yod //
translated: so what else remains?

original: srid pa'i chu bo'i rjes 'brang ba'i //
analyzed: srid pa'i chu bo'i rjes 'brang ba'i //
translated: Those who follow the river of existence

original: ma rig mun pa 'jig rten dang // srid pa med pa'i mkhas pa rnams //
analyzed: ma rig mun pa 'jig rten dang // srid pa med pa'i mkhas pa rnams //
translated: The world of ignorance and darkness, and the wise who are free from existence,

original: dam pa dang ni ji ltar mnyam //
analyzed: dam pa dang ni ji ltar mnyam //
translated: how are they equal to the holy ones?

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de lta bu'i rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni //
translated: Thus, the Great Vajradhara is

original: phan yon dang bcas pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: phan yon dang bcas pa'i tshig go //
translated: the words with their benefits.

original: de rnams kyi bzhugs gnas su gyur pas so zhes pa ni gang gzhi'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bzhugs gnas su gyur pas so zhes pa ni gang gzhi'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin zhes pa'o //
translated: The nature of the ground mandala is the abode of those.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gshegs pas na zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan gyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gshegs pas na zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan gyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the Tathagatas go there, it is the nature of the factors of enlightenment, which have the characteristic of the collection of qualities of all the Tathagatas.

original: sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor dag dga' ba'o zhes pa ni sku dang gsung gi cha de la yon tan gyi sgo nas yod kyi gtso bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sku dang gsung gi dkyil 'khor dag dga' ba'o zhes pa ni sku dang gsung gi cha de la yon tan gyi sgo nas yod kyi gtso bo ni ma yin no //
translated: The mandalas of body and speech are joy, meaning that the aspects of body and speech exist there in terms of qualities, but are not primary.

original: gtso bo ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor nyid de kun gyi nang na thugs mchog yin pas so //
analyzed: gtso bo ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor nyid de kun gyi nang na thugs mchog yin pas so //
translated: The principal one is the mind mandala itself, because it is the supreme mind of all.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dag ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor dag ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mandalas of body, speech, and mind will be explained below.

original: dkyil ni snying po'o zhes pa la dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: dkyil ni snying po'o zhes pa la dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The mandala is the essence. This is the definition of the reality of the mandala.

original: mi mnyam pa med pas gru bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa med pas gru bzhi pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is called the square because it is without inequality, and so on.

original: de len pas na dkyil 'khor @191b zhes bya'o //üîΩde'i rnam pa lta ba'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa zhes pa ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi sems can gyi khams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir dbang po rno bas rtogs par bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: de len pas na dkyil 'khor @191b zhes bya'o // de'i rnam pa lta ba'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa zhes pa ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi sems can gyi khams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir dbang po rno bas rtogs par bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi
translated: It is called the mandala because it takes that.üîΩThat which is the mandala of the form of that is the mandala of the form of the reality of the mandala.

original: chos rnams thabs bla bas rtogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: chos rnams thabs bla bas rtogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: Here, the Blessed One Vajradhara, in order to take care of the realms of sentient beings who are of the type of passion and so on, for the sake of understanding the Buddha's teachings that are to be understood by those of sharp faculties by means of the most excellent method,

original: gru bzhi pa dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo nas bstan to //
translated: taught the mandala by means of the mandala that has four doors.

original: gang gis de dag dkyil 'khor 'dri ba dang 'jug pa dang / de'i de kho na nyid thob pas sangs rgyas kyi chos de rnams khong du chud cing dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis de dag dkyil 'khor 'dri ba dang 'jug pa dang / de'i de kho na nyid thob pas sangs rgyas kyi chos de rnams khong du chud cing dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By drawing the mandala, entering it, and attaining its reality, one will understand those qualities of a buddha and attain the state of glorious Vajradhara.

original: phyi rol gyi dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang gru bzhi pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang ldan pas dgos pa ni cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dmar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang gru bzhi pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang ldan pas dgos pa ni cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is not the slightest purpose in having the external colors such as red, or the shapes such as square.

original: las dang po pa'i sems can 'jug pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i sems can 'jug pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The mandala and so forth were taught by the BhagavƒÅn for the purpose of engaging sentient beings who are beginners.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: chen po ma yin thung ba min //
analyzed: chen po ma yin thung ba min //
translated: Not large, not short,

original: ring po ma yin zlum po min /
analyzed: ring po ma yin zlum po min /
translated: not long, not round,

original: tshad dang ldan pa nyid thob pa'i //
analyzed: tshad dang ldan pa nyid thob pa'i //
translated: having attained the very state of measure,

original: gzhal med khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod //
analyzed: gzhal med khyod la phyag 'tshal bstod //
translated: I pay homage and praise you, immeasurable one.

original: dmar dang ljang dang dud ka ste /
analyzed: dmar dang ljang dang dud ka ste /
translated: Red, green, and smoke-colored,

original: khyod la kha dog mi dmigs te //
analyzed: khyod la kha dog mi dmigs te //
translated: you are not observed as having color.

original: dkar nag ser po ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: dkar nag ser po ma yin pa'i //
translated: Not white, not black, not yellow,

original: kha dog las 'das khyod la 'dud //
analyzed: kha dog las 'das khyod la 'dud //
translated: I bow to you, beyond color.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus he spoke.

original: dkyil 'khor 'dra ba zhes pa ni de ltar gyur pa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor yang ;
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'dra ba zhes pa ni de ltar gyur pa gzhi'i dkyil 'khor yang ;
translated: The mandala is similar to that, and the fundamental mandala is also like that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with the assembly of the qualities of all the Tathagatas.

original: yid du 'ong bas na zhes pa la rin po che 'bar ba nyid kyi sems la tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong bas na zhes pa la rin po che 'bar ba nyid kyi sems la tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: It is pleasing because it satisfies the mind with the brilliance of the jewels.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words are just as they are because of the explanation of the mandala.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gsung gis zhes pa ni sdud ba pos rjes su brjod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gsung gis zhes pa ni sdud ba pos rjes su brjod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The speech of Great Vajradhara is the recitation by the compiler.üîΩThen is the division of the words.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi skabs 'byed pa'o zhes pa ni tshig phrad rnams don du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni tshig gi skabs 'byed pa'o zhes pa ni tshig phrad rnams don du ma dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words are endowed with many meanings.

original: de'i phyir zhes pa'i sgra ni gtan tshigs kyi don te zhes pa la snga ma'i rnal ma la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa'i sgra ni gtan tshigs kyi don te zhes pa la snga ma'i rnal ma la ltos pa'o //
translated: Therefore the word ‚Äúthus‚Äù has the meaning of a reason.

original: bkra shis dang ni dbang nyid brjod//
analyzed: bkra shis dang ni dbang nyid brjod//
translated: It is said that the words ‚Äúauspicious‚Äù and ‚Äúempowerment‚Äù are expressed.

original: de nas sgra dang de phyir sgras /
analyzed: de nas sgra dang de phyir sgras /
translated: Then the word ‚Äúthus‚Äù and the word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù are expressed.

translated: Just as the four mƒÅras of the aggregates and so on are unable to disturb the mind of the BhagavƒÅn who has entered the vajra-like samƒÅdhi, in the same way, this ma·πá·∏çala is also unable to be disturbed,
